title: Fixed a Physical Issue
body: The chair is perfect!  I have it in my art studio.  The chair before it was pinching a nerve and gave me foot pain whenever I worked.  Now, I can adjust the Verve Chair to a comfortable height, arm chair height and adjust the depth.  I am able to work for many hours and have no pain.  It’s the best investment I’ve made for my physical being in a long time!  Thank you!

title: Excellent!
body: I've had a lot of expensive office chairs over the years and I've always thought that they were not as comfortable as they should be. When I saw instagram ads for Branch and saw the prices, I was very skeptical but decided to take a risk. WOW. I've been beyond impressed. It may be the extra cushioning and the fabric back, but I never get uncomfortable or hot sitting in the chair compared to some of the higher end leather chairs I've had in the past. The settings also let me adjust it to exactly my preferences, which is great. My only criticism is that the arm adjustments need some work; it is hard to set them even and you can undue the height setting on them pretty easily on accident. PS - the light green mint color is so nice. Great job Branch! I've already bought a second for my home office!
full_review: Excellent!: I've had a lot of expensive office chairs over the years and I've always thought that they were not as comfortable as they should be. When I saw instagram ads for Branch and saw the prices, I was very skeptical but decided to take a risk. WOW. I've been beyond impressed. It may be the extra cushioning and the fabric back, but I never get uncomfortable or hot sitting in the chair compared to some of the higher end leather chairs I've had in the past. The settings also let me adjust it to exactly my preferences, which is great. My only criticism is that the arm adjustments need some work; it is hard to set them even and you can undue the height setting on them pretty easily on accident. PS - the light green mint color is so nice. Great job Branch! I've already bought a second for my home office!

title: Back and Hip Pain Are Gone
body: I’ve been suffering from low back and hip pain ever since Covid and the start of working from home full time. I had purchased a cute looking office chair but it definitely didn’t have any sort of real support. I finally decided that for something I sit in 10 hours a day, I should buy something that won’t cause me health problems to come. After a TON of research on many different brands, I finally decided on the Verve. It is SO comfortable and with all the different points of adjustment it works well for me only being 5 feet tall. The chair is even more beautiful in person. Highly recommend!

After a TON of research on many different brands, I finally decided on the Verve. It is SO comfortable and with all the different points of adjustment it works well for me only being 5 feet tall. The chair is even more beautiful in person. Highly recommend!

title: Best office chair ever!
body: Purchasing was easy (and love the color options), shipped and arrived ahead of schedule (which never happens with furniture these days), assembly was extremely easy yet is solid and not flimsy, and I love using the chair! I spent over 6 months trying to shop for a chair and couldn’t be more pleased!! I love that I can also later decide to add the headrest if I decide that would work better ergonomically. I don’t think I’ve found any other where that decision can be made after the initial purchase, great option to have! I highly recommend Branch and the Verve chair to anyone!!

title: An absolute game changer!
body: I am so happy I discovered BRANCH and the Verve Chair! I had been shopping for a bar-height adjustable stool for my tall workbench, but they were so clunky and fussy that I couldn't commit. Drawn by the aesthetic of Branch, I went to their store in NYC and fell in love with the comfort and adjustability of Verve. Buying a "regular-height" chair actually meant I had to completely reconfigure my workspace and lower my bench, and it is SO WORTH IT! No more pain, no more twisting, no more using a stool as a footrest... and I get the bonus of a nicely controlled recline (with head rest!) that is helpful when in videoconferences or simply watching videos. The deep blue is very classy. The ability to control the depth of the seat is invaluable. At first I was bummed the arms don't adjust but that's proven not to be an issue for me. I'm hoping they come out with PURPLE!

The deep blue is very classy. The ability to control the depth of the seat is invaluable. At first I was bummed the arms don't adjust but that's proven not to be an issue for me. I'm hoping they come out with PURPLE!

title: I Love This Chair
body: I love this chair! It gives my back support comparable to my car seat which previously was my most comfortable seat anywhere. The chair is very attractive both in the design of its structure and its fabric. It arrived incredibly well packaged, and it went together with the precision of a Swiss watch, complete with the tool to tighten the fasteners and even a couple extra bolts. I have found it easy to adjust to the perfect height and perfect seat and back positions.

The chair is very attractive both in the design of its structure and its fabric. It arrived incredibly well packaged, and it went together with the precision of a Swiss watch, complete with the tool to tighten the fasteners and even a couple extra bolts. I have found it easy to adjust to the perfect height and perfect seat and back positions.

title: This is my second Verve…
body: And like the first one, I love it. I bought it for my work office because I sit at a computer 8-10 hours a day. This chair, and I speak from experience after having my first chair 2.5 years (and it’s holding up no problem) that this chair is extremely comfortable while also being really stylish. The back supports my spine so well and is very adjustable. The seat is firm but curved to support your bottom so it actually feels vet comfortable. It doesn’t squeak being made out of metal and it’s so minimal that it doesn’t take up a huge part of the room like some chairs. I highly recommend this chair to anyone that wants a comfortable, ergonomic, super stylish chair. For reference I ordered the mint and already had a white. Both colors are as true as the photos.

I highly recommend this chair to anyone that wants a comfortable, ergonomic, super stylish chair. For reference I ordered the mint and already had a white. Both colors are as true as the photos.

title: Best Home Desk Chair
body: To start, generally, it takes me forever to make a decision on large purchases (especially home decor related purchases). However, the desk chair I had been using for several months (8+ hours a day bc I WFH) was a wooden dining room table chair and I couldn't sit through one more meeting where, literally, my butt falls asleep. So, when I saw the recommendation in The Daily Skimm email, I immediately went to the website and started to research Branch desk chairs. Branch offers five different desk chairs. When there are multiple choices, I usually pick the one in the middle (price-wise) because you never want to cheap out by buying the least expensive option and usually you don't need all of the bells and whistles of the most expensive option; however, I really liked the aesthetic of the Verve - how the frame and the upholstery are the same color. The Verve also has the best color options and I selected cobalt blue. If I had to have a desk chair, it's nice to not have black or gray since I have neither of those colors in my office. And perhaps more importantly, the chair is comfortable. Definitely more comfortable than a dining room chair and as comfortable (or maybe more comfortable) as other desk chairs I have had over the years. Stylish AND comfortable - I definitely recommend.

title: The best purchase I have ever made
body:
To say that this is the best purchase I have ever made really hurts me. I love to complain about the miserable service,
wretched quality of the product, nothing fit, incomprehensible instructions, everything. But I cannot. The chair was so well packed that it took me half an hour to unpack. I have never seen so much cardboard, Styrofoam, and plastic. My children are building a full scale model of the tower of Babel.
 The chair was really well packed and incredibly heavy. Luckily my son was there to lift it out. Things made out of really good steel seem quite heavy. Again, it was incredibly well packed. Curses.
 And then everything fit - perfectly. Because I am clumsy, I did need help from my Wife - who mocked me because of my incompetence.. The items were tight, fit perfectly, and really annoying, 
 Sadly, I have even been so satisfied that I have recommended it to my doctor. Ah, well, not everything be garbage and poorly made.
 One more thing. All of the modes or the chair worked. I am comfortable. It goes in and out, up and down, back and forth, and everything functioned. Why can't it fail and be horribly made? 
 It really is a superb product. I have never had a better chair. I was President of an insurance company and my office kept buy me all sorts of chairs. I wish this one was available.

 And then everything fit - perfectly. Because I am clumsy, I did need help from my Wife - who mocked me because of my incompetence.. The items were tight, fit perfectly, and really annoying, 
 Sadly, I have even been so satisfied that I have recommended it to my doctor. Ah, well, not everything be garbage and poorly made.
 One more thing. All of the modes or the chair worked. I am comfortable. It goes in and out, up and down, back and forth, and everything functioned. Why can't it fail and be horribly made? 
 It really is a superb product. I have never had a better chair. I was President of an insurance company and my office kept buy me all sorts of chairs. I wish this one was available.

title: Easy Set Up, Amazingly Comfortable
body:
The set up of this chair took me a total of 15 minutes, most of which was spend unboxing. The set up is so simple, and while you could do it alone, I did benefit from having my husband help me hold the chair in place while I screwed in the base and arms. 

I've only owned this chair for 24 hours, but man let me tell you the adjustable elements of this chair are really amazing! I can't believe how comfortable it is. As someone who spends 8 hours a day at the computer for work, this is a furniture item I splurged on (which I rarely do). I went with the white color, but man... the mint really tempted me. 

Treat yo' self people! If you are a remote worker this is what dreams are made of.
full_review:
Easy Set Up, Amazingly Comfortable: The set up of this chair took me a total of 15 minutes, most of which was spend unboxing. The set up is so simple, and while you could do it alone, I did benefit from having my husband help me hold the chair in place while I screwed in the base and arms. 

I've only owned this chair for 24 hours, but man let me tell you the adjustable elements of this chair are really amazing! I can't believe how comfortable it is. As someone who spends 8 hours a day at the computer for work, this is a furniture item I splurged on (which I rarely do). I went with the white color, but man... the mint really tempted me. 

Treat yo' self people! If you are a remote worker this is what dreams are made of.

title: Excellent Ergonomic Chair
body:
I purchased the Verve chair from Branch and I am so happy with the product. It shipped quickly and it was super easy to setup out of the box.The material used is high quality and durable, it’ll last years I am sure. Lots of options to get the chair to fit your preferences just right. 

I work two jobs from home and I have a standup desk so that I can switch from sitting to standing, but I have tested and can easily sit 8+ hours without feeling uncomfortable or sore as per Branch's advertisement. 

If you’re on the fence about your next office chair, you can’t go wrong with the Verve (especially for the price point. I’ve bought $1,000 chairs that are TERRIBLE compared to the Verve).

title: High quality materials, thoughtfully packaged for a pleasant unboxing experience!
body:
Our Verve chair was quick and simple to assemble, the quality of materials shows in the weight and feel of all components. The chair is easy to adjust for multiple users and has provided great relief for my partner with occasional back pain.

Unboxing our Verve chair was such a pleasant experience as well! You can immediately tell upon opening the box, that the packing process has been thoughtfully planned out and I trusted that each piece would be in perfect condition--which it all was!

High quality materials, thoughtfully packaged for a pleasant unboxing experience!: Our Verve chair was quick and simple to assemble, the quality of materials shows in the weight and feel of all components. title: Does not provide “all day comfort"
body: To be honest, I’m very disappointed after all of the positive reviews I read before purchasing this chair. While the design, features, and build quality are top notch and worthy of the price, the comfort in the seat just isn’t there. I am nowhere near the maximum rated weight for this chair and the cushion compresses all the way to the seat pan in very short order resulting in a hard seating surface. This becomes very uncomfortable after 10-15 minutes…hardly “all day”.
full_review: Does not provide “all day comfort": To be honest, I’m very disappointed after all of the positive reviews I read before purchasing this chair. While the design, features, and build quality are top notch and worthy of the price, the comfort in the seat just isn’t there. This becomes very uncomfortable after 10-15 minutes…hardly “all day”.

title: Where have you been all my life.
body: As someone who has been working from home for almost 10 years now, I can not believe I haven't invested in a better chair sooner. This chair has made such a difference for me. I could (and do) spend hours in this thing.

title: Chic & Comfortable
body: I've been suffering a whole host of aches and pains - shoulder, back, and my bum. I bought some back and bottom support cushions which helped somewhat but ultimately I had a cheap inadequate office chair and a desk at the wrong height. I had to address the real issue once and for all so researched more ergonomic options and that's how I discovered Branch. After reading all the positive reviews, I took the plunge and bought the chair. It's completely worth it. It looks great and more importantly feels great because it's adjusted to fit me and how I like to sit. The difference is noticeably significant. No longer experience pain in my back or bum nor have any cushions to constantly readjust. I still have minor shoulder pain but that has to do with my desk being too high, which means my next step is to purchase a desk from Branch to match my chic office chair!

title: Ended up sitting at my desk for hours
body: The chair is great. Time went by and i noticed hours in that I hadn’t felt uncomfortable. The first couple of days I cranked out 7-8 hours of work which was not typical and noticed how comfortable it was. The only issue I have seen is that it’s kind of hard adjusting the arm rests because if you pull it all the way up, it drops back down.

title: finally a chair that fits
body: Wonderful! I tried all your chairs at the NYC showroom and decided on Verve. Ordered it right then and there. It was delivered to my home in Vermont within a week. My husband and grandson put it together and I have been using it ever since. I am retired and use it in my home office for the usual household tasks; bills, taxes, record keeping, etc. and also for reading the NY Times online. So not for long stretches, but perhaps an hour or two at a time. It perfectly adjusts low for keyboard height or higher for zoom appointments and webinars. I am thrilled with my mint green Verve chair.

title: Life changing!
body: Wow!! I usually don’t write reviews but the Verve chair is a life changer after only having used it for a day and a half! I’m short, so it’s very hard to find a chair that adjusts every way that I need it to. This chair was simple to put together and only took a minute to set the adjustments perfectly. All of the pieces are so well made and excellent quality, especially the backrest fabric. It has a slight stretch and has a nice feel to it. My back doesn’t ache and even though I sit for 8 hours, it doesn’t feel like I’ve been sitting for hours. I’m so glad I made the decision to purchase, it’s well worth the price. I’m telling everyone I know to get one!

title: Best chair ever?
body: I was using a a steel folding chair at my desk for almost a year before I decided to do something about the lower back pain. This chair is magic; it encourages good posture and supports my whole body. I’ve already been more productive as a result of being able to sit and focus for longer. Plus the slimmer profile of the chair fits perfectly in my work area. No complaints whatsoever, best $600 I’ve ever spent!

title: Beautiful and comfortable
body:
I had been looking for a new at home office chair for awhile. My problem is that I want something that is both functional and esthetically pleasing besides a plain black or gray office chair. I am also petite at 5 ft so standard office chairs never hit the right areas for my child size body :P

I had my eye on the verve chair after seeing a lot of IG ads, but it's price had me hesitant. Well I started a new job and figure they have a small holiday sale so I decided to go for it. 

Okay first the shipping was fast. I got in 2 days! The chair was carefully packaged and I appreciated the instructions and cards in a neat small folder. They also had all the screws and tools packaged neatly with labels instead of just throwing them into a plastic bag, and the allen wranch has a nice handle instead of those L shape metal ones. I honestly really appreciated these gestures. While it seems like a tiny thing, I found it helpful and kept things organized and easy. I really dislike putting items or furniture together but it was really easy with instructions and the holes for the pieces actually line up! Often times these assembled furniture has alignments that are off. 

I love the beautiful neutral mint green color. It gives it a nice pop of color and makes it so welcoming. It's also incredibly comfortable and fits my petite body. If you are like me and second guessing this purchase, don't! I love my new chair and they have a 7 year warranty!
full_review:

I love the beautiful neutral mint green color. It gives it a nice pop of color and makes it so welcoming. It's also incredibly comfortable and fits my petite body. If you are like me and second guessing this purchase, don't! I love my new chair and they have a 7 year warranty!

title: Best looking ergonomic desk chair anywhere
body: I love this chair so far! I had disc surgery 2 months ago, and was nervous about buying the right chair, but this one has plenty of adjustments to make it "fit" my body properly. I also resisted buying a chair because most of them are so ugly. Except for this one (I love the monochromatic colors). It's also really well made—especially for the price—and easy to assemble.

I also resisted buying a chair because most of them are so ugly. Except for this one (I love the monochromatic colors). It's also really well made—especially for the price—and easy to assemble.

title: Striking Color - Rigid Comfort
body: I love the color - I was afraid it would look different in person, but the image color is very true to reality. The comfort and angle adjustments are slightly tricky to get used to, especially adjusting the rigidity of the lean function. I wish the arm rests were able to adjust a little taller. When sitting upright in the chair, my elbows barely reach the arm rests and do not reach if I extend my arms at all to use a keyboard. All of the other functions are very intuitive and easy to customize. Once adjusted, it is a very comfortable chair.
full_review: Striking Color - Rigid Comfort: I love the color - I was afraid it would look different in person, but the image color is very true to reality. The comfort and angle adjustments are slightly tricky to get used to, especially adjusting the rigidity of the lean function. I wish the arm rests were able to adjust a little taller. When sitting upright in the chair, my elbows barely reach the arm rests and do not reach if I extend my arms at all to use a keyboard. All of the other functions are very intuitive and easy to customize. Once adjusted, it is a very comfortable chair.

title: 5 Stars
body: I am still finding the right adjustments for me to support my lower back (there are many adjustments, which I love). I have to say this chair is better in person, it’s such a great color. I tried so hard to not get a proper office chair because I don’t like how they look and this is the first one I liked enough to buy! It is good quality, you can tell when putting it together that the hardware and everything is made to last. When I opened the box I dreaded putting it all together but it was packed so well and the instructions were very clear, it only took 15 minutes. So far I’m very happy with me verve chair! The only thing I would say would add would be to be able to move the arm rests front to back - you can adjust then up and down but id like to move them forwards, toward my desk.

title: 5 Stars
body:
absolutely blown away by the build quality, design, and installation procedure for this chair. The milling and heft of the connector pieces is unlike any flat pack product I have ever seen. Even the hex wrench supplied was made to use, so much so I didn’t even bother getting one of mine - definitely not your typical “L” wrench. The fact that branch even throws wrench in two extra bolts (one of each type) is just the sort of thing that costs very little on the front end and can solve enumerable inconvenience down the road. 

Now if the chair was uncomfortable, no one would care about the great design or robust materials, but the fact is at 6’4” I found it a great chair and at 5’4” my wife did to. The chair is for easily adjustable- unlike so many that have tons of levers that have little or no discernible function or one that practically gives you whiplash. my wife does tele-health daily and a quality chair is essential. this chair has put a smile on her face for sure!

title: 5 Stars
body: I'm 43 years old and have sat in many chairs throughout my 20+ years in the workforce. None of them compare to this chair. Now that I work from home, it's imperative that I have something that I enjoy sitting in. This chair is comfortable, stylish, flexible, and easy to put together. It feels sturdy and glides across my floor with ease. The price is worth every cent and I would easily buy it again if needed. I will recommend this to anyone looking for a gorgeous and comfortable fixture in their home.

title: Wonderful, ergonomic, high-quality, beautifully designed chair!
body: First, regarding the size of this chair: this is a standard size office chair which should fit most people in a fairly wide middle range of the height and weight curve. I am a 6'0", 175-pounds male and this chair fits me perfectly, with plenty of room left and additional height adjustment available, so it's hard for me to understand reviews complaining about the small size. This chair was designed so thoughtfully and economically that all unnecessary bulk was eliminated, contributing to it's very elegant and esthetically pleasing appearance. The quality of the materials is top-notch, warm and pleasant to the touch. The seat is soft and yet firm enough to keep me from sinking to the bottom of the seat frame like I did in every other office chair I tried. Like the rest of this chair, the ergonomics were designed thoughtfully to fit most people's needs, without pilling on unnecessary adjustments. The back support on this chair is the most comfortable and effective I've experienced. Overall, this is the best office chair of the many, many... many I have tried and a tremendous value. I do, however, understand that chairs are kind of like clothes and shoes where one size does not fit all, but I sure am glad this one was a fit for me. PS: I even liked the arm rests system! Very elegant and functional.

Very elegant and functional.

title: Love this chair
body: I was hesitant to purchase because of the price, but ended up ordering it during the BFCM sale. I have absolutely no regrets, this is the comfiest chair I've ever sat on in my life and the mint color is just beautiful. My back doesn't hurt at all after sitting for a full 8 hour work day. To anyone who's on the fence about purchasing this chair, just get it!

title: Great chair, very comfortable and adjustable with the $$
body:
It's been great so far, 2 months in. I love it. Best purchase I could of made for my home office. Super comfortable, adjustable, and perfect for my needs. Worth the $$.

The only bad thing I will say is the arm rest locking design. It's very hard and annoying to tell when the arm rest reaches the top most locking pin, if you pass that pin it goes all the way down. Leading to so much frustration. The better design would be for the arm rest to stop at the top, and then the user would have to press a button to have it drop down to the bottom.

title: Good chair with a great look
body:
I have been using the chair for 3 weeks now and I can definitely say it has helped me considerable with back issues due to long work hours. Users have complained about the arm rests, I have not had too much of an issue after you get the hang of them after first use, although I am a relatively slim person. The seat does seem to lean forward a bit, but maybe that might be the design intent as with the straight back I think it helps to correct posture. 

It is a great looking chair and comfortably comparable to higher priced chairs, while only lacking in some features that but otherwise a great buy.
full_review:

title: ADHD gamer girl dream chair!
body: I have ADHD and I am a gamer + grad student, and I have been in search of a chair what will allow me to sit cross-legged comfortably, sit one knee to my chest while the other is crossed under my body all while still having space on the seat to be comfortable. I also wanted a chair that has good armrests that are a good height/distance from my desk and allow me to actually use them while gaming. This chair was perfect for all of those needs! Plus more that I wasn’t even looking for. My favorite part of the chair is that the seat slides forward for my room to sit, which allows for the ADHD sitting. The adjustable back rests also gives me the ability to rock in my chair! Another yay! I had looked at the TikTok adhd chair, but I didn’t like that there was basically no backrest and the seat looked super small and uncomfortable. Then I found this chair! 10/10 would buy again! My husband is jealous and now wants the same one! While it is on the more expensive side I truly think the price is worth it! There is no cheap craftsmanship on this chair. Plus all of the fun colors?! If you can afford it buy it!

I also wanted a chair that has good armrests that are a good height/distance from my desk and allow me to actually use them while gaming. This chair was perfect for all of those needs! Plus more that I wasn’t even looking for. My favorite part of the chair is that the seat slides forward for my room to sit, which allows for the ADHD sitting. The adjustable back rests also gives me the ability to rock in my chair! Another yay! My husband is jealous and now wants the same one! While it is on the more expensive side I truly think the price is worth it! There is no cheap craftsmanship on this chair. Plus all of the fun colors?! If you can afford it buy it!

title: Great chair...could use some more environmentally sustainable options
body:
A simple transaction, quick shipping, and great price on a local product. While I really love all aspects of the Verve chair, it did; however, arrive slightly damaged. More likely due to poor handling during shipping and not due to the packaging. 

The Branch team was very responsive about the damage and quickly offered to remedy the situation by sending me a replacement backrest and base with rollers. My only issue with this was that it's a ton of waste (materials, resources, and carbon). I requested a partial refund or a discount on other products in lieu of shipping new parts and disposing of the damaged ones, but was advised that Branch does not offer such things. 

Yes, their customer service was attentive and offered to fix the problem, but I was a little disappointed they did not have a policy in place or could accommodate a more environmentally friendly option. Even though Branch mentions sustainability on their website, perhaps some other options or greater flexibility can be considered in the future. 

In the end, i opted to keep the damaged parts instead of wasting resources.

My only issue with this was that it's a ton of waste (materials, resources, and carbon). I requested a partial refund or a discount on other products in lieu of shipping new parts and disposing of the damaged ones, but was advised that Branch does not offer such things. 

Yes, their customer service was attentive and offered to fix the problem, but I was a little disappointed they did not have a policy in place or could accommodate a more environmentally friendly option. Even though Branch mentions sustainability on their website, perhaps some other options or greater flexibility can be considered in the future. 

In the end, i opted to keep the damaged parts instead of wasting resources.

title: Sitting Pretty: The Verve Chair by Branch – A Petite CEO's Perfect Partner in Comfort and Style!
body:
As someone with a petite frame, finding the perfect chair for long hours at my desk has always been a challenge. Enter the Verve Chair by Branch, and I must say, the search is finally over!

What impressed me most is the six points of adjustment that the Verve Chair offers. From tilt and tilt lock to seat height, depth, armrest, and lumbar adjustments, this chair allows for a truly personalized fit. As a CEO, comfort and functionality are vital, and the Verve Chair delivers on both.

The 3D knit back is not only aesthetically pleasing but also breathable, offering cool comfort throughout the day. I care about how my office looks, and I appreciate the sleek, low-profile touch that perfectly complements my workspace.

Recommended for bodies ranging from 5'0" to 6'0" and up to 275 lbs, it's clear that Branch has thoughtfully designed this chair to accommodate various sizes. The adjustable lumbar rest and contoured seat provide natural spine support, promoting an upright posture that I've found incredibly beneficial.

Whether for home offices or professional interiors, the Verve Chair stands out as a top choice, rated for 8+ hours of comfortable work. For all my fellow petite professionals out there, the Verve Chair by Branch could very well be the best-fitting chair you'll ever experience. I couldn't recommend it more!

title: Great Chair Even For (Some) Tall People
body: Fantastic chair. Solid cast metal base, super comfy cushion and backrest. Great lean back feeling with tension adjustment and angle lock controls. Arms are minimal but great shape to keep out of the way when sit in different positions, though they're slightly wobbly side to side. Doesn't affect how I use the chair but it depends what you need the arms for. Lots of reviews here say it's not for tall folks, but I'm 6'-2" and because I have a slightly long torso and not as long legs, this seat height (at max height) fits me perfectly. For reference, I usually go with a 32" jeans inseam. Measure the height of your current chair seat when your legs are at 90° and if it's 20.5" or less you're good to go.

Great lean back feeling with tension adjustment and angle lock controls. Arms are minimal but great shape to keep out of the way when sit in different positions, though they're slightly wobbly side to side. Doesn't affect how I use the chair but it depends what you need the arms for. Lots of reviews here say it's not for tall folks, but I'm 6'-2" and because I have a slightly long torso and not as long legs, this seat height (at max height) fits me perfectly. For reference, I usually go with a 32" jeans inseam. Measure the height of your current chair seat when your legs are at 90° and if it's 20.5" or less you're good to go.

title: A good alternative to higher priced chairs
body:
This is a great chair for the price. I would give it 5 stars if not for two small gripes (both relating to the armrests).

For some context, this is not my primary office chair, but it does get used frequently. The chairs in my office and home office are from other well-known manufacturers but cost several times more ($1,500-$2,000ea).
 
Pros:
- I expect it to last a long time, as it appears to be well made. 
- The chair is comfortable, even though it is not as adjustable as some (mostly higher priced) chairs. 
- Assembly is exceptionally easy.
- It is a good looking chair.

Cons:
- The armrest "pads" need more padding. The pads are maybe 3/8 inch thick and very hard. This may not be an issue for everyone - the desk I am using is a little too tall, which results in my elbows contacting the pads instead of my forearm. Either way, a little softer padding would be an improvement.
- This is a small complaint, but the armrest height adjustment can be frustrating. To adjust, you simply lift the armrest and an internal ratcheting mechanism clicks into place. The height increments are very fine, which is good. The only issue is when you try to adjust the armrest to its highest position. There is no indication you have reached the topmost detent and it is easy to lift it too far, which causes the mechanism to release and fall to its lowest setting.

Overall, I would recommend this chair.

- Assembly is exceptionally easy.
- It is a good looking chair.

Cons:

This may not be an issue for everyone - the desk I am using is a little too tall, which results in my elbows contacting the pads instead of my forearm. Either way, a little softer padding would be an improvement.
- This is a small complaint, but the armrest height adjustment can be frustrating. To adjust, you simply lift the armrest and an internal ratcheting mechanism clicks into place. The height increments are very fine, which is good. The only issue is when you try to adjust the armrest to its highest position. There is no indication you have reached the topmost detent and it is easy to lift it too far, which causes the mechanism to release and fall to its lowest setting.

Overall, I would recommend this chair.

title: Verve Chair - Great Chair
body: Fantastic from the moment I sat down. A game changer. Great for short people. I am 5'4" and constantly have the problem of too deep of a seat for an office chair (the seat front would always hit the back of my knees which would then prevent me from being able to sit firmly against the back of the chair so my lower back/lumbar never had support.) This chair has a shallower seat with the option to slide the seat out if you are taller. And it has a good strong lumbar support. This is a really comfortable chair that is alleviating backpain and discomfort. I sit at a desk staring at a computer 8 hours a day 5 days a week. A great purchase. The price definitely makes you hesitate but if you spend 40 hours a week in an office chair you need a good chair to take care of your body and mind. You are worth it! A bad office chair will crush the soul and body. I am really pleased.

title: The upgrade I needed
body: Since beginning work-from-home three years ago, I had routinely convinced myself that I needed a "cute" chair and not a chair that could offer lumbar support (or any support for that matter). I finally decided to seek out an ergonomic option due to ongoing soreness with my back. I've used this chair for two months now and am so happy with the investment. I purchased the "mist" color which is a sort of soft gray and white that blends in seamlessly and doesn't feel too "office-like" in my multipurpose office/guest room. I'm amazed by how comfortable of a fit I'm able to achieve with a few minor adjustments. At 5', I am able to adjust the seat height (and my sit/stand desk) so that my feet are comfortably flat, which is a totally new thing for me! I can't compare this to other "real" office chairs at this price point, but I can safely say it's revolutionized my sitting-for-hours life. I don't have the arm rest issue others report - I know they're sensitive, but I just don't tend to trigger them often. Also agree with others re: the lumbar support - it does shift throughout the day, but I actually don't mind adjusting it as needed. Would love a head-rest option at some point, but otherwise, I really have no complaints and would recommend this chair to anyone seeking an upgrade!

Also agree with others re: the lumbar support - it does shift throughout the day, but I actually don't mind adjusting it as needed. Would love a head-rest option at some point, but otherwise, I really have no complaints and would recommend this chair to anyone seeking an upgrade!

title: Everything I wanted and More
body: Firstly the assembly was much easier than i assumed it would be, only a few mechanisms to put together and i was all set! Second, now i’m a bit biased because the chair i had been using at my desk was a cesca cane dining chair so the difference of comfort between that chair and this one is pretty astronomical! This one is perfect i lead zoom calls i do a lot of talking and gesturing and leaning this way and that and this chair has allowed me to walk away without lower back pain after all of that!

title: Even better than expected...
body:
It was super quick to put together compared to other chairs I've purchased online. When I first sat in it I was SHOCKED. I felt a relief in my lower back for tension that I didn't even know was there. Not exaggerating even a little. This chair is probably saving future me from a world of hurt. 

The tilt back is also tight enough that I can fully relax and recline without startling myself or feeling like I'm going to tip.

title: Great chair, great for long periods of sitting
body: I bought this chair for my wife while she studies for a major professional exam. She has been studying for 8 to 11 hours per day (trust me, she times herself and does not include breaks), and has been complaining about back and hip pain for a month. I bought her this chair as a surprise and it has dramatically helped her pain. She definitely spends too much time sitting, but since she has to, I am glad that she is sitting in this chair. And when she is done with her professional exam and goes back to actually working outside of the home for a living, I am looking forward to using this chair myself so that I can use it in my work-from-home position.

title: Best Chair EVER!

title: Worth the money
body: Beautiful design! I work from home and I developed sciatica bc of it. This chair is so pretty and it’s been nice on my back. Assembly was literally so easy as well. The only thing that bothers me is the mechanism that controls the degree tilt lock. I haven’t gotten a hang of it and it doesn’t stay at the degree I want it to.

title: Good chair, great customer service
body: This chair was very easy to assemble out of the box. In terms of comfort, I would rank it above average. It helps me sit up and encourages good posture with the light lumbar support. The chair is on the smaller side. At a 5’11”, it fits nicely. If I was a few inches taller, I’d consider a different chair possibly. However, the thing I was most impressed with was the customer service at Branch. My right arm rest was loose and rattled to the point that it distracted me throughout the day. I reached out to support and they had another arm rest sent out within a day. I was very pleased with how responsive they were and how they stood behind their product.

title: Terrific Home Office Chair
body:
Putting in the work hours at home requires a great chair. I’d tried two other options- one light and cheap, the other stylish, trendy and expensive. After a few weeks of use, the third party seat pads didn’t help. The Branch Verve sounded great, and while a bit pricey, I went for it. 
Straight out of the box, the quality was immediately apparent- this thing is SOLID. Assembly was straightforward with clear instructions. 
Having used it now for a few weeks, I’m very satisfied with its quality and comfort. I’m having no problems sitting and maintaining my focus throughout the day. The fabric and other construction materials are holding up great. The chair looks and feels great.

title: Insanely comfortable
body: I bought this after some research, and it was one of the few chairs built for 5'4" folks. It was a little heavier than I thought so it made it hard to assemble for me. Aside from that this chair is really comfortable! I can see why others might not be so fond of the arm rests, but other than that, it's cushy and good back support. I wish there was a attachable headrest sometimes, but otherwise, it's great! I definitely recommend it for people near my height since it's much cheaper than big-name brands, but relatively affordable.

title: I shouldn't have waited
body:
I love this chair! As a WFH person, my office chair sees lots of hours. I finally invested in comfort and this chair delivered! My office is very visible so style was important, and this chair is as pretty as it is comfortable.
I also ordered the Standard up in a bundle. Also --- never thought I would love an adjustable desk so much. The ability to custom set the height to match how I am sitting or standing is so nice! I am now such a believer. I've had standup desk additions before but not a fully moveable desk.
Both items needed assembly and when assembled are not light --- but assembly was smooth and easy ... Chair took about 20 minutes and the desk a little over an hour. 
And the best piece, I was debating between colors of the chair with the desk. I contacted customer service and a very nice person at Branch ran around their office and pulled together the desk color and the chair color combinations I was considering and emailed me pictures. I ordered 5 minutes after that.

full_review: Love my new chair: So comfortable, well built, easy to assemble, love the coral colour!

title: It's a good chair
body: Though my cats have already obliterated the chair's good looks, it remains comfortable. It has taken a little time to get acclimated to the smaller size compared to my previous chair, but my posture is improving, and the far higher quality of construction accepts my millennial style of sitting down (pile driver) far more gracefully than other chairs I have owned. The arm height adjustments sometimes frustrate as the reset point often comes suddenly and without warning, but once they're set, they hold fast. I've never been a fan of arm rests that tilt along with the back of the chair, but that's a minor quibble, and not something with subtracting a star. Overall, it's a good solid office chair, and it doesn't hurt that I feel like an adult using it, in stark contrast to the poor quality gaming chair I'm replacing, which made me feel like a child, but not in the good way where I feel invincible and unaware of my mortality.

title: Overall fantastic, one small issue
body: Overall this is an exceptional task chair. It is more configurable and comfortable than most. It was also easy to assemble alone. The one small issue is that the control to lock the back in place versus showing it to rock back-and-forth is non-intuitive. It often takes us several trial-and-error attempts to unlock it. That said, we love this chair so much that we bought a second and would definitely recommend it to others.

That said, we love this chair so much that we bought a second and would definitely recommend it to others.

title: TRUST ME, JUST BUY IT
body:
This is the review I wish I've would read when/before buying this chair, so you're welcome.
To start off, I am 5'4", work full-time remotely, plus part-time remote student, so I basically live in this chair now. Before this chair, I had the ergonomic chair from Ikea which was insanely uncomfortable for the amount of time I spent sitting (10+ hrs a day). After that chair, I bought one from a brand that its name start with H and it is a very famous ergonomic chair brand, ifykyk. Anyways, instantly returned because for the $ it was not worth it and it was a huge chair for a girl like me. If you are taller than 5'7" or 5'8" at most, stop reading and find another chair, I sit in this chair to its max height and my knees are 90 degrees, so this chair is definitely not for tall people at all but other reviews already mentioned that. 

With the amount of research I did on ergonomic chairs for a price range of this chair, I should get a certification on ergonomical knowledge. This chair is extremely comfortable, I have never felt back pain since I started using it, when the tilt is locked at the top, you sit perfectly at 85 degrees (90 is too upstraight for me). The cushion on the seat is like memory foam (look at pics for illustration) and you will never get tired or feel unsupported. I have enough space to sit criss cross, or L-shaped (look at pics) if that makes sense at all. I have enough room in this chair to sit however I want. The arm rests are a little bit wider out but I like it since it gives me room to sit with one leg on the seat, etc. The back rest is sooooo nice, breathable, mesh so your back melts into it, it's just perfect. I couldn't find a prettier chair that was all white since I have OCD and for whatever reason, I was not going to buy a black chair even if it's the best chair in the world, my room is beige and white so a black chair for me is a no. Anyways, it's a beautiful chair and it is extremely comfortable. IGNORE THE BAD REVIEWS. IGNORE!!!! I don't understand how could anyone have anything bad to say about this chair, unless you're 6' tall then I get it. Their warranty is great, the chair got here in less than a week, so easy to put together by myself, came packaged super nice and clean. The lumbar support definitely a plus, I like that I can adjust exactly where I want the support. The tilt functions are awesome, I'm constantly changing the tension. I use all the features of this chair and you will too. Compared to so many chairs out there, this chair is perfect for the price (find a discount online, I did through their Instagram). 

This chair is extremely comfortable in every aspect; back, legs, bum, arms, lower back, knees, and most importatly (to me), it's beautiful and goes with my room. Just buy it.

title: Sitting on a cloud!
body: I have always been interested in Branch Furniture but it wasn’t until recently that I decided to bite the bullet and splurge a little on an office chair I desperately needed. Coming from an “executive” office chair sold by a major office supply chain that shares a name with an office tool, I was pleasantly surprised at how big of an upgrade getting a Branch chair was. The purchase process was great as the website provided all the information I needed to make an informed decision. The checkout process was also smooth and my chair shipped almost immediately. I ordered my chair Monday night, and received it Wednesday morning! Granted, I live in a major city, but that is still very impressive. The unboxing experience was also great as everything was packaged well and the tools needed to assemble was presented very aesthetically. Installation took less than 30 minutes, and did not require much strength. The first time sitting in the Verve chair was magnificent. The chair has exceeded my expectations. Not only is it well designed, the build quality is above anything else that I’ve looked at. Compared to the Ergonomic chair, the Verve is for those that value comfort, ergonomics AND DESIGN! If Apple made a chair, this would be it. For the price, you cannot find anything better. Highly recommend, from someone who has sat in it for almost a month, 8 hours a day.

If Apple made a chair, this would be it. For the price, you cannot find anything better. Highly recommend, from someone who has sat in it for almost a month, 8 hours a day.

title: My physical therapist says thank you
body: My physical therapist and all of my friends told me I should stop sitting in an open-box Amazon Basics chair for 18 hours a day. One of my friends took me to the Branch showroom and I sat in all of the chairs and decided that the Verve worked best for my long torso and short legs. My physical therapist noticed that my mid-back was much less knotted up a week after I received the chair in the mail. So there you go with that.

title: Great work chair
body: I've worked from home for 10 years, and recently have experienced neck and shoulder pain. I reluctantly paid for this chair. It was packaged well. The weight of the seat alone weighs more than my current chair. It is a solid heavy chair, in comparison to my current one, which seems mostly plastic. Kudos to whomever designed the packaging for the hardware, and to whomever wrote the assembly instructions. Assembling even the simplest of things is not my forte. The instructions along with the hardware packing were perfect, and thank you for the extra screws, just in case, and labeling them that way. Two days in, and my neck and shoulder pain have significantly decreased.
full_review: Great work chair: I've worked from home for 10 years, and recently have experienced neck and shoulder pain. I reluctantly paid for this chair. It was packaged well. The weight of the seat alone weighs more than my current chair. It is a solid heavy chair, in comparison to my current one, which seems mostly plastic. Kudos to whomever designed the packaging for the hardware, and to whomever wrote the assembly instructions. Assembling even the simplest of things is not my forte. The instructions along with the hardware packing were perfect, and thank you for the extra screws, just in case, and labeling them that way. Two days in, and my neck and shoulder pain have significantly decreased.

title: Comfortable Chair
body: I am happy with the purchase of 2 Verve Chairs from Branch. Online ordering was easy, product was shipped out fast, set up was simple and customer service was kind and responsive. My coworker and I both like that the seat is firm, yet comfortable, it can slide forward & back vs just up & down, the tilt back can be tensioned, the lumbar is easy to adjust as are the arms. Overall, the Verve Chair by Branch has left a positive impact and may result in future purchases with Branch.
full_review: Comfortable Chair: I am happy with the purchase of 2 Verve Chairs from Branch. Online ordering was easy, product was shipped out fast, set up was simple and customer service was kind and responsive. My coworker and I both like that the seat is firm, yet comfortable, it can slide forward & back vs just up & down, the tilt back can be tensioned, the lumbar is easy to adjust as are the arms. Overall, the Verve Chair by Branch has left a positive impact and may result in future purchases with Branch.

title: Comfortable and looks great
body: This chair is a big upgrade from the Amazon Basic chair I had been using; the lumbar support, seat cushion and seat back are comfortable and supportive. I did try the ergonomic chair first, but found the lumbar support far too hard and unforgiving. The lumbar support for the Verve on the other hand is perfect. The only thing that could use some work are the armrests - once adjusted they are fine, but they are easily pulled out of adjustment and somewhat of a pain to reset. Other than that, this chair has been perfect for me.

I did try the ergonomic chair first, but found the lumbar support far too hard and unforgiving. The lumbar support for the Verve on the other hand is perfect. The only thing that could use some work are the armrests - once adjusted they are fine, but they are easily pulled out of adjustment and somewhat of a pain to reset. Other than that, this chair has been perfect for me.

title: What my back needed for years
body: All of the furniture used in my university was from Steelcase, after graduation I looked for the same experience and comfort because as an architect, I'd easily spend 14 hours a day seated. I stumbled upon this brand and decided to give it a try. Not only do they offer payment plans that make your purchase way more feasible, but the overall design in terms of comfort, looks and changes that you can custom once at home (position of the bottom cushion, arm rests height, degree of back inclination, etc.) make this product a no brainer. I used to have my mind fixed at buying something from Steelcase, and I'm so happy to have put my trust in this brand, I'll definitely continue to invest in them in the near future. Give it a shot, you won't regret it and your overall posture will THANK YOU.

title: I'm in Love!
body: This chair is phenomenal. As a shorter person (5'2"), I appreciate that I can adjust the depth of the seat. I can comfortably sit with my feet fully on the ground. I can also extend the seat so that I can sit cross legged in the chair. The movable lumbar support is perfectly customizable. The back of the chair is breathable yet very supportive for my back. The arms of the chair are easily adjustable too. I love this chair so much that I am considering ordering a second one for another room in my house. The only problem with this chair is that it is so comfortable that I just want to relax in it instead of do work - haha! I love it!! I 5/5 stars! I highly recommend this chair.

title: Well made and comfortable
body:
How a chair is assembled is important. The instructions were very simple and the assembly was easy. The screws and the assembly tool were in a plastic container that once two staples were removed there was easy access to the parts. No need for a box cutter to rip open the plastic. The screws were easily inserted with no issues. 
 Adjustments to the chair are straight forward. The instructions were detailed enough to understand the adjustments. There is no squeaking whatsoever. The chair rolls easily on a hard plastic mat I have on a hardwood floor.
full_review:
Well made and comfortable: How a chair is assembled is important. The instructions were very simple and the assembly was easy. The screws and the assembly tool were in a plastic container that once two staples were removed there was easy access to the parts. No need for a box cutter to rip open the plastic. The screws were easily inserted with no issues. 
 Adjustments to the chair are straight forward. The instructions were detailed enough to understand the adjustments. There is no squeaking whatsoever. The chair rolls easily on a hard plastic mat I have on a hardwood floor.

title: Other businesses take note… this is how it’s done
body: We recently bought a Verve office chair and absolutely love it. It is way more comfortable than my last chair so makes it easier to manage the work day. My wife is also an interior designer, so we have a very high end office, and the white chair is stunning in the space. But the best part that I want to highlight is the effort and care from the organization. Companies can learn a lot from Branch. Each step of the way, communication was clear, the chair came quickly and was in great shape, and I got a follow up email confirming delivery and that all was in good shape. the day after the chair arrived I noticed a new spring sale, and it would have saved us $70. I reached out to Branch, and within 24 hrs they automatically adjusted the cost to give us the deal without any delay or hassle. That was so appreciated. So if you're thinking of getting a Branch product... go for it! You will be impressed.

But I invested on this chair in order to try to sit on something that will help with preventing back pain I have felt while sitting for a long time on previous dates. This is truly a wonderful investment, being able to go without any pain is worth it.

title: Comfortable and highly adjustable
body: I've never had a good experience with a desk chair and am so glad I took the chance on this Verve chair. The mist color is beautiful and the fabric is a very interesting combination of knit and stretch on the back of the chair, which keeps you cool and comfortable. The seat is well cushioned, and almost every part of the chair is adjustable (easily!). I had trouble figuring out the tilt lock, but there is a video online by Branch on YouTube that helped me get it right. I love the seat adjustment to slide it forward or backward to get the seat to hit the right place behind your knees. I put this chair together in less than 30 minutes and could not believe it was as simple as it was and that the chair would hold up. But it is that easy, and it has held up well so far! Warning: this fabric is just the kind of fabric that cats love to get their little claws on, so I do recommend covering the chair to protect the fabric when not in use if your cats are sometimes jerks like mine are. Do not hesitate to buy this chair. I've sat for hours in it comfortably, and I'm so glad I splurged on it. I got it with the standing desk and do stand part of the day, but I think I could sit in this chair all day and still feel good.

The mist color is beautiful and the fabric is a very interesting combination of knit and stretch on the back of the chair, which keeps you cool and comfortable. The seat is well cushioned, and almost every part of the chair is adjustable (easily!). I had trouble figuring out the tilt lock, but there is a video online by Branch on YouTube that helped me get it right. I love the seat adjustment to slide it forward or backward to get the seat to hit the right place behind your knees. I put this chair together in less than 30 minutes and could not believe it was as simple as it was and that the chair would hold up. But it is that easy, and it has held up well so far! Warning: this fabric is just the kind of fabric that cats love to get their little claws on, so I do recommend covering the chair to protect the fabric when not in use if your cats are sometimes jerks like mine are. Do not hesitate to buy this chair. I've sat for hours in it comfortably, and I'm so glad I splurged on it. I got it with the standing desk and do stand part of the day, but I think I could sit in this chair all day and still feel good.

title: Beautiful Chair
body: I've been looking for a compact stylish chair for a while. It's difficult to find office chairs in beautiful colors. The verve chair in coral is just gorgeous. I've had my chair for almost a month now and I love it. The only issue is that the adjustment for the arm height could be better. It's not that user friendly as it can be difficult to get it to lock at the desired height. Other than that the other adjustment features are great. I really like being able to adjust how far the back can lean. I also like the size of the seat and how they designed the arms. They are attached in a way that you can sit cross legged if you want without the arms of the chair getting in the way.

title: Very comfortable
body: I work from home and needed a new chair. I researched this for months and finally decided on Branch after reading all the positive reviews and I liked the looks of the chair. I decided on the Verve chair. The mesh back is ver comfortable and hugs your back. It also helps you sit more up right without being to much. The seat is soft yet firm. It feels like it will hold up well over time. I can honestly say it is comfortable to sit in for 8-10 hours a day. My one small complaint would be the lack of padding on the arm rests. While there is some padding there it could be a little more or a little softer. With that said I would still highly recommend this chair.

Again because the back does not move upright I have had to make the seat very short (pushed back) to feel the lumbar support.

title: The chair I was looking for
body:
I was looking for a new office chair to use for my home office space. I couldn't get anything too big, but I also wanted a chair that was big enough for me to criss-cross my legs. I really like how this is the right size for a lot of seated positions. The back is really comfortable. I really like how many points of adjustments there are on this chair as well. And I splurged on the pretty coral color which was worth it. 
And the assembly was really, really easy. Easier than some IKEA furniture :)

title: Less back pain - cute color
body: Employer gave me money to buy a WFH chair; otherwise I'd never buy something this pricey. I have a tiny house and wanted something in a cute color since I can't tuck the chair out of the way. Also needed something that actually helps with the back pain I've accumulated from WFH life since COVID. I'm sort of shocked to report that my back hasn't hurt since I switched to this chair. I'm petite at 5'2" and other than feeling a bit like I'm being "pushed forward" while sitting, it is supportive. Actually do recommend if you have the budget for it.

title: So comfortable
body:
For the last couple years I had been using a stiff Ikea chair pilfered from my last office when it closed. I've been adding cushions, oiling rollers, re-tightening bolts, but still experiencing horrendous lower back pain by the end of every work week. I knew I needed a new chair but having sat on dozens of different ones, I was dreading the idea of dropping several hundred dollars on yet another one that wasn't comfortable, wore out easily, and was a giant ugly nuisance in my home office. I considered various stools, ergonomic contraptions, decorative velvet seats, executive chairs, gaming chairs, but I always felt like I would be sacrificing something by buying each one: quality, comfort, price or aesthetics.

Finally a coworker (a large dude) mentioned that he bought a Branch chair and was really enjoying it. Enjoying? I had never heard that said about a desk chair before, so I took the quiz, read lots of reviews, and decided to buy a gray/white Verve about three months ago.

First, pulling the cushion piece out of the box, I was amazed how heavy & sturdy it felt. After much unpacking, I assembled everything in about 10 minutes while I was chatting with a friend over facetime. My friend interrupted me to ask if they could see the chair in the room and remarked, "wowww, it's beautiful. Is that weird to say about office furniture?" It is, but it's true!

Adjusting the chair to fit was less clunky than a lot of chairs I've used. I was concerned that the white frame would scratch easily, as my dog likes to claw my seat for attention, but that hasn't been the case at all. The seat is firm enough that it doesn't feel like it'll collapse after 6 months, but not so firm that it's uncomfortable. I love the bouncy tilt of the backrest, which allows me to lean back and stretch often and helps prevent & alleviate lower back pain.

title: Comfortable, stylish, easy to assemble
body: Have been using the Branch Verve for a few weeks now. Great upgrade over my old mesh chair! Also, a beautiful chair.
full_review: Comfortable, stylish, easy to assemble: Have been using the Branch Verve for a few weeks now. Great upgrade over my old mesh chair! Also, a beautiful chair.

title: easy to assemble and extremely comfortable
body:
I never write reviews for products i buy online, but I felt inclined to do so for this chair. I couldn't believe how extremely easy it was to assemble. All of the parts and screws were labeled and it took approximately 7 mins to assemble alone. I will say, it doesn't go up that high after adjusting the seat height, but it's perfect for me considering I'm about 5"3. 

It's the most comfortable desk chair compared to the Herman Miller Sayl Chair, it's definitely up there. And for $500? It's a great deal. I would definitely recommend this.

easy to assemble and extremely comfortable: I never write reviews for products i buy online, but I felt inclined to do so for this chair. I couldn't believe how extremely easy it was to assemble. title: Beautiful and functional
body:
Quite an attractive chair and so far - three hours in - it is very comfortable. 
It took longer than expected to arrive (9 days) but came to the front door well packaged.
The chair was easy to assemble - in spite of how heavy it is! The instructions were clear and in good English.
I did have to watch the online video to learn how to operate the arms. I thought they were broken because every time I would pull them up they would fall back down.
What I realized was that I was pulling them ALL the way up too fast and they were releasing.
The trick is to SLOWLY click them in place - I think it is 8 total adjustments to the top - and not rush. 
Since discovering that trick they have been solid as a rock!

The seat cushion is very thick and supportive and the back rest can be adjusted in many different ways.
I am very pleased with this purchase!
full_review:

The trick is to SLOWLY click them in place - I think it is 8 total adjustments to the top - and not rush. 
Since discovering that trick they have been solid as a rock!

The seat cushion is very thick and supportive and the back rest can be adjusted in many different ways.
I am very pleased with this purchase!

title: Substantial Chair with great features
body: While the chair is great overall and able to be controlled to my comfort, the chair came with a tear in the lumbar support. The box was not damaged, but you could tell that the padding protective wrap around the lumbar support area was missing. I have contacted Branch to yet get a response so hopefully this will stimulate a response so I can follow up on the review. The chair, however, is fantastic.

title: Very Pleased
body: I don't have a huge amount of experience with office chairs, but I am really pleased with my experience so far. The Verve chair is comfortable even for a shorty like myself (just under 5 foot) and it is easy to adjust and manipulate. It's quite a heavy chair, which was the only real challenge in an otherwise straightforward assembly process, and the armrests sometimes slide out of place and protest being returned to the correct setting -- but those are minor issues. (Also, the peach color is beautiful and a very cheerful addition to my workspace.) Overall, I'm glad I splurged on this piece.

title: Verve Chair is everything I hoped it would be!
body: Color was perfect, assembly was easy (although I recommended two people to get the seat in the base as it’s kind of heavy and the base will wheel around), it’s so comfortable, leans way back if you’re into that. I’m 5’2” and was able to adjust everything to make it “juuust right” for me. The only complaint are the arm rests, which do simply fall down if you barely start to try and adjust them. I don’t need to adjust them, so I leave them alone and all is well but hopefully Branch will figure this out and maybe even have better performing replacement arm rests? Overall so thrilled with my chair!

title: Super Quality Chair
body: I was eying some other high end chairs initially, but stumbled across Branch because of social media ads. I liked the design and initially investigated, but found that I got better value out of this vs. the similarly priced luxury level chairs. It shipped and arrived way faster than any of the other chairs I would have ordered and feels extremely sturdy and durable. I've also used it for several full work days without any kind of posture problems, so I'm super happy with my purchase!

title: 10/10 Would Buy Again
body: I've used lumbar support pillows with my 75$ mainstay chair to help with my scoliosis and back pain. When I was ready to invest in this chair, I was weary but purchased it during Black Friday, and it's my favorite purchase of the entire year. The additional cushion for my bottom and natural support for my back has helped me stay engaged while working from home, and I've noticed I don't have back pain from long work days anymore.

title: Exactly what my back needed
body: Shipping was free and overnight! I received my chair so quickly and just as quickly put it together -- and that's saying a lot since I can't assemble anything. The only downside is how heavy the top part is once assembled so getting it to slip onto the base was no small feat, but I finally got it. I'm sitting in it right now and am IN LOVE. I work from home 2-3 times a week so I needed something more ergonomic and comfortable. My old desk chair was from a high-end furniture store and cost over $1000, and it was the most uncomfortable thing ever. I'm so thankful I finally broke down and scored the Verve chair with the holiday discount. Seriously happy as a claim. Thank you, Branch <3

title: Worth every dollar!
body:
I was nervous to make such a big investment on a chair, but as someone who spends 8-12 hours a day at my desk, I really wanted a chair with proper support. The Verve has totally surpassed my expectations! The quality of the materials and the comfort level is way better than I expected. 

As a designer, I also care about the aesthetics of my office furniture. The coral chair is so unique and the colour is gorgeous in person. 

Some of the adjustments can be finicky (I find the tilt lock a bit difficult) but honestly that is such a small concern – what matters is how great my back feels after sitting in this chair all day!

title: Instant relief
body: I was using a relatively expensive "task" chair before purchasing the Verve. I read a bunch of reviews online about the Verve, and I was skeptical to believe all of them, but now I do! This is a well-designed, well-constructed, easy-to-assemble, solid overall chair. I alternate between sitting and standing, but I have been able to sit for longer stretches since purchasing this chair--without my back feeling it! The sense of support and adjustability is phenomenal. Took me maybe 10 minutes to slap it all together. Can't recommend this chair highly enough!

body:
I love my new desk chair so much - it actually makes me want to sit at my desk when I usually roam the house with my laptop from kitchen table, to couch, to reading chair throughout the day. My posture and back/neck pain has improved dramatically as a result. 

I'm 5'0" tall/110 lbs, so I'm not sure how well suited this is for taller folks, but I'm so glad to have found a chair that finally works for petite folks -I feel like chair design usually leaves out this end of the height spectrum when thinking about comfort. Thanks so much for considering the shorties!

title: A Pretty Perfect Office Chair!
body: The verve chair exceeded expectations. It’s solidly built, very comfortable but supportive, and has lots of adjustable features. The cushioned seat is so comfortable and the lumbar support is just enough. I prefer the verve to my office’s Herman Miller chair. I was worried it would not be worth the cost, but frankly it’s a good deal! It also looks so sleek and modern, it really elevates the clunky office chair. The webbing on the back is textured and slightly stretchy adding to its unique and stylish look. All in all, a wonderful chair, I almost look forward to working. Almost.

title: Very Satisfied & No Complaints
body:
I’m a second-time university student who has aged between degrees, and I have a hard time sitting in a chair every day for as long as I could when I was young and resilient. I started this degree in a stationary molded Eames chair at a dining table, eventually bought a desk and then a $200 chair from Wayfair that I thought was both functional and pleasing to the eye. The foam in the seat quickly failed, the armrests were at an uncomfortable height, it squeaked at a godawful (and unrepairable) pitch, and I’ve had awful trouble with back pain after sitting in it for extended periods (even just 4-8 hours in a day). I ended up back at the dining table in a stationary chair for 3/4s of my last semester because I could no longer tolerate it. 

Returning to my desk this fall, I knew I wouldn’t make it. I spent countless hours scrolling through Amazon.ca for a replacement chair for ~$200, checked local retailer websites, and couldn’t settle on something I liked, that looked nice, and had reviews suggesting the chair would last more than a year. So, I did some more searching and discovered Branch furniture on the West Elm website. It is logistically and cost prohibitive for me to order from West Elm, so I found Branch’s flagship website and was thrilled to find out the prices direct from Branch are more competitive, delivery is faster (and free), there’s a warranty offered, and there’s a Canadian version of the website so no additional fees for currency conversion or shipping duties. 

My new desk chair cost nearly 4x what I was originally planning to pay, but I do believe that it is a solid product that will last beyond the end of this degree (I won’t have to replace it for $200 every year), and it packs some great value into its build. Given that my first degree is in interior design, I’m familiar with the costs of high-end home and commercial office furniture, and I’ve sat in my fair share of sample chairs. I can confidently say that this chair has exceeded my expectations and is the most comfortable office chair I’ve sat in! AND it’s beautiful. I love the adjustments, I appreciated the video overview, assembly was easy, it’s a solid build, and I’m delightfully surprised every time I sit down in it. For as long as Branch stands by its own values, 100% I will recommend their products to friends and colleagues.
full_review:

title: Amazing Quality Chair
body: Received the chair about a week and a half after I ordered it. This chair is seriously awesome. It’s night and day compared to the last chair I owned. My last chair was about $300 off of Amazon and it was horrible. The lumbar support didn’t even touch the back of the chair and didn’t adjust in any way, only went up and down, the seat went flat after 3 months, and it had a deafening creak every time I moved an inch. It was so bad, I actually preferred to work from the couch every day, which was painful on my back. The Verve chair is the opposite. Adjusts in multiple different ways, the fabric is great quality, strong and breathable, plush but firm seat, and I actually feel a difference in my posture with the lumbar support. I highly recommend this chair, the price point is more than Amazon or Wayfair chairs but is so worth the investment.

title: Took a chance and it paid off huge!
body: I was pretty anxious about buying an office chair online without ever having sat in it - but as soon as I sat down, I knew I'd made a good choice. One week in, I've decide it's a great choice!!! I love this chair. The seat is the perfect level of soft but supportive, and the back's flexibility makes me smile every time I lean back! It took just seconds to figure out how I wanted to adjust everything. I echo some other reviews that mention the arms being a little funny to adjust - very sensitive to the touch - but that's just a teeny quibble. Easy to assemble by myself, all the tools provided. Really thrilled with this investment and eager to recommend to my friends.

title: Transformational!
body: Amazing product and has transformed my work from home experience. Easy and quick to set up on your own, comfortable, easily adjustable and I no longer have back pain at the end of the day. Sleek, modern look that I couldn’t find elsewhere. Highly recommend. Thanks Branch team!

title: Love my new chair! It was worth the wait.
body: I am 5'10" and my son is 6'6". Chairs are a difficult purchase for us tall folks, especially if you have long legs. Grant you this was going to be my new home office chair, but even though I didn't want my son using my chair, realistically I knew he would want to borrow it for gaming when he comes home on breaks from college. So after extensive research, I pre-ordered the Verve chair in coral. I looked at many chairs, but focused on these brands: Branch, Herman Miller, All33, the Xchair and Steelcase. One would have thought I was writing my thesis. I loved the Verve upon sight, however it was not even available yet. I struggled to make a decision knowing I would spend hours a day in this chair and my body depended on me making the right decision. Once I learned that the Branch Verve chair was designed by the design firm founded by Yves Béhar (responsible for the Henry Miller Sayl chair) I knew my instincts were right to go with the Verve. I would wait months to find out if I were right. And I was! I LOVE this chair. I can sit for hours (I try to take a walk breaks every hour), and not have excruciating back pain at the end of my day. I love all of the adjustments I can make, and how easy it is to maneuver. And the color! My son will not be back from college until December or January, so we will have to wait for his feedback. In the meantime if you want this chair you should order it!!
