I struggled to make a decision knowing I would spend hours a day in this chair and my body depended on me making the right decision. Once I learned that the Branch Verve chair was designed by the design firm founded by Yves Béhar (responsible for the Henry Miller Sayl chair) I knew my instincts were right to go with the Verve. I would wait months to find out if I were right. And I was! I LOVE this chair. I can sit for hours (I try to take a walk breaks every hour), and not have excruciating back pain at the end of my day. I love all of the adjustments I can make, and how easy it is to maneuver. And the color! My son will not be back from college until December or January, so we will have to wait for his feedback. In the meantime if you want this chair you should order it!!

title: Fantastic chair and beautiful color
body: The chair arrived safely, and was easy to assemble. I decided to use my own wheels, and they were easy to install since the measurements were standard. The coral color is beautiful, and suits the decor well. I do feel like the back rest wants to propel me out of the chair, or has me sitting at an acute angle. It’s eased up a little since I’ve first started using it, but I’m having a hard time “clicking” the back rest into any position other than fully reclined or fully upright. I love all the adjustments and settings, and the seat cushion is supportive and comfortable. I’m hoping the back rest will ease up a little more, and I’ll be on the lookout for the headrest!
full_review: Fantastic chair and beautiful color: The chair arrived safely, and was easy to assemble. I decided to use my own wheels, and they were easy to install since the measurements were standard. The coral color is beautiful, and suits the decor well. I do feel like the back rest wants to propel me out of the chair, or has me sitting at an acute angle. It’s eased up a little since I’ve first started using it, but I’m having a hard time “clicking” the back rest into any position other than fully reclined or fully upright. I love all the adjustments and settings, and the seat cushion is supportive and comfortable. I’m hoping the back rest will ease up a little more, and I’ll be on the lookout for the headrest!

title: Beautiful and Functional
body: Very beautiful chair that compliments my office quite well. It has just the right amount of adjustability to allow me to cater it to my preferences without being at all complicated. Bravo!
full_review: Beautiful and Functional: Very beautiful chair that compliments my office quite well. It has just the right amount of adjustability to allow me to cater it to my preferences without being at all complicated. Bravo!

title: Finally, a beautiful & comfortable ergonomic chair!
body: I've been using my Verve chair for 2 weeks. The first thing I noticed of course is how nice it looks in my office. I wondered if it would actually be comfortable & functional too. And it is! I love all of the adjustments you can make. I have a hard time finding chairs that go low enough for my 5'1" stature; this chair works for me! I haven't had any pain after sitting in it for long periods of time. I'm so happy I took a chance on this chair, as I was previously considering spending over $1500 on a top-of-the-line ergonomic chair that doesn't seem to have many benefits over this one.

I wondered if it would actually be comfortable & functional too. And it is! I love all of the adjustments you can make. I have a hard time finding chairs that go low enough for my 5'1" stature; this chair works for me! I haven't had any pain after sitting in it for long periods of time. I'm so happy I took a chance on this chair, as I was previously considering spending over $1500 on a top-of-the-line ergonomic chair that doesn't seem to have many benefits over this one.

body: It took me a solid month of research to find a desk chair that is ergonomic, pretty, and reasonably priced. It seems as though the office chair industry decided as a whole that you could not have all three things in the same chair. Then Branch appeared. I bought my chair in Coral, and love it. Worth the price in comfort and style.

title: Professional grade chair
body: Love this chair. I prefer to work from the office but this chair allows me to be comfortable when I work from home. Love the sleek look and design of this office chair. The gray color is sublime. The seat is very comfortable and the back gives room to breathe during hot afternoon in our den. It swivels well. I like the lean back functionality but I’ve yet to figure out how to limit it to around 30 degrees. The price is steep but you do get what you pay for.
full_review: Professional grade chair: Love this chair. I prefer to work from the office but this chair allows me to be comfortable when I work from home. Love the sleek look and design of this office chair. The gray color is sublime. The seat is very comfortable and the back gives room to breathe during hot afternoon in our den. It swivels well. I like the lean back functionality but I’ve yet to figure out how to limit it to around 30 degrees. The price is steep but you do get what you pay for.

title: Beautiful Ergonomic Chair
body: This chair is both comfortable and beautiful. I have had back problems for a while and struggled to find a chair that was ergonomic but also fit my decoration style. The Verve does both and it is more affordable than any designer chair. Highly recommend!
full_review: Beautiful Ergonomic Chair: This chair is both comfortable and beautiful. I have had back problems for a while and struggled to find a chair that was ergonomic but also fit my decoration style. The Verve does both and it is more affordable than any designer chair. Highly recommend!

title: Nice chair but...
body:
I spent months looking at office chairs, trying to find the right one.  I chose the Verve chair because it indicated that it was good for longs days, 8-10 hours, of working.  Another review indicated that they were very fidgety and liked how they could sit different ways and still be comfortable.  

After owning the chair for 3 1/2 weeks I am returning it.  It is a beautiful chair but the seat is firm. By mid-afternoon I felt like I was sitting more on a bench with a pad as their was no give in the seat cushion.  When sitting back in the chair, one would consider properly, after a bit I would feel like a bar was going across my butt.  I thought it might be the curve up of the chair, which would be logical, but there was not curve.  Never did figure that one out.  

Fidgety - I could be somewhat fidgety but not like before.  I tend to pull a foot up under my knee, sometimes I sit cross-legged (which I really couldn't do in this chair), I just move a lot.  I am short and keep a stool under my desk, and with that I bring my legs up and down to the seat of the chair.   I sit 9 hours a day so I change positions a lot!!  The chair's seat did move forward and back, giving more room if I wanted it.  Nice feature of the chair.

Arms - the most annoying!  If you would lift the chair up with the arms, the arms came up with you!  They go back down easily and then you pull them back up the height  you wanted.  I wish they would have locked in place.  Many times my chair would get stock on the edge of the rug and I would need to pick it up, I changed to picking up the seat instead of the arms.

The lumbar was nice - not too firm.  You could adjust it up and down.  You had to tighten the back of the chair, otherwise when  you leaned back, you really leaned back!!

The return - so far it has been easy, without challenge.  They offered to consult with me to be sure I had the chair adjusted correctly but I declined - the arms and the bar across my butt was difficult to overcome,  They send very detailed instructions on how to take the chair apart  AND how to pack it back in the box!!  We were doing good until getting the hydraulic off the seat, will have to call support for help with that. 

It is a very good and solid chair.  Beautiful fabric, smooth resin.  I really wish the chair would have worked.  Now I have to find another chair with busy season already here.

If a “pro edition” came out with a black leather, I’d be the first one to purchase. Great product, great company! :)

title: Beautiful Chair
body: The chair was fairly simple to assemble except for the headrest. We had to chisel paint off the threads of the screw to get it to screw in. My lower back hurt a bit at first but I think I have the lumbar adjusted correctly now. Overall, happy with the purchase.
full_review: Beautiful Chair: The chair was fairly simple to assemble except for the headrest. We had to chisel paint off the threads of the screw to get it to screw in. My lower back hurt a bit at first but I think I have the lumbar adjusted correctly now. Overall, happy with the purchase.

title: A few design issues
body:
One on assembly and one on performance. 

The assembly issue is inserting the wheels into the base. I've assembled two of these chairs and both were difficult. "Requires some force" does not begin to describe the more than two hundred pounds of pressure required to insert one or another wheel. This is not rocket science and should have been better executed.

The second is performance. The adjustment for stops in leaning back the chair is fussy and difficult to use. Both my wife and I have had problems with the adjustment. Again, it looks like a design and manufacturing problem that should not have been done in this way.

The assembly issue is inserting the wheels into the base. I've assembled two of these chairs and both were difficult. This is not rocket science and should have been better executed.

The second is performance. The adjustment for stops in leaning back the chair is fussy and difficult to use. Both my wife and I have had problems with the adjustment. Again, it looks like a design and manufacturing problem that should not have been done in this way.

title: High quality product
body: Well designed and constructed with high quality materials.
full_review: High quality product: Well designed and constructed with high quality materials.

title: Pretty great, just one issue
body: I love the chair, it's very comfortable and glides very easily when necessary. My only issue is the level in which it lays back. There's really only 2 recline levels. The one is to keep it upright for support where you can't slouch at all and the 2nd is ALL the way back where you're almost laying down. I wish there was an in-between or a couple of in-betweens. It's 2 very drastic recline levels. Other than that, it's great.

There's really only 2 recline levels. The one is to keep it upright for support where you can't slouch at all and the 2nd is ALL the way back where you're almost laying down. I wish there was an in-between or a couple of in-betweens. It's 2 very drastic recline levels. Other than that, it's great.

title: Overall satisfied
body: It's a good looking chair, and fairly comfortable. I'm not sure the back support is hitting at the right height for me. It was a little challenging popping in the wheels during assembly. While I'm overall satisfied and will be keeping it, I haven't tested enough chairs to know if the quality is worth the price.

It was a little challenging popping in the wheels during assembly. While I'm overall satisfied and will be keeping it, I haven't tested enough chairs to know if the quality is worth the price.

title: Branch Verve Review
body:
I enjoy it, but I feel the shoulders don't get enough support for my height, and the back of the seat could use more cushioning, especially for taller people like me. For the price the armrests should be more adjustable as well, with the ability to tilt the arm rests, and adjust the width. As well as the tilt tension and locking should be more dynamic, rather than a few notches.

The headrest has helped with the shoulder issue some since I have something to support my neck and head. However, that has brought it's own issue of not going up high enough. The top of the headrest at max height stops right a few inches above my foramen magnum (the hole in the back of the neck, where the spinal cord goes up). It cushions the back of my head a little. Don't know if it was a design choice or not to let it support the neck mostly or not, but that's my thoughts on it.

Beyond that I enjoy the chair, and don't have to keep my muscles tense to sit comfortably, like in my old, failing chair. It's a very comfortable, and I don't have to focus on how I'm sitting.

Branch Verve Review: I enjoy it, but I feel the shoulders don't get enough support for my height, and the back of the seat could use more cushioning, especially for taller people like me. For the price the armrests should be more adjustable as well, with the ability to tilt the arm rests, and adjust the width. As well as the tilt tension and locking should be more dynamic, rather than a few notches.

The headrest has helped with the shoulder issue some since I have something to support my neck and head. However, that has brought it's own issue of not going up high enough. The top of the headrest at max height stops right a few inches above my foramen magnum (the hole in the back of the neck, where the spinal cord goes up). It cushions the back of my head a little. Don't know if it was a design choice or not to let it support the neck mostly or not, but that's my thoughts on it.

Beyond that I enjoy the chair, and don't have to keep my muscles tense to sit comfortably, like in my old, failing chair. It's a very comfortable, and I don't have to focus on how I'm sitting.

title: Good chair, wish it had some upgrades
body:
The chair is comfortable and very nice looking. I really liked how much I can lean back. Materials feel really nice and comfy. There are a couple things I wish they redesigned:

1. Lumbar support: not quite supporting as I was expecting. I ended up putting my lumbar pillow on it. 
2. Arm rest: it’s great they can come up and down, however they can’t be moved horizontally, which it’s needed depending on how much forward you are on the chair so your arms are not hanging.
3. I’m 5 feet tall and bought this chair because it was more inclusive with different heights, however feel like the current lowest setting its still not low enough for my feet to touch the ground if I’m properly sit, I have to move a little forward so my feet can fully be on the floor however this leaves a between my lower back and the chair. 
4. I did not buy a headrest because I didn’t use to have one on my previous chair (different brand)z The back of this chair seems to be lower and now I’m gonna have to buy the head rest.

title: Aesthetic Chair
body:
I've had a difficult time looking for "good looking" ergonomic chair and this one really fits the bill! It looks beautiful (I wish there were more color options, I had a difficult time choosing between the coral and mint.) - while it doesn't completely fit in with my office color theme, the comfiness of the chair makes up for it. I would give this chair a five star just for the looks and comfort, but I had a bit of a shipping issue where the bolts to put the chair together were completely missing from the package. Their customer service was great and they were able to ship the missing items in a few days. It was just a little frustrating as I didn't have a computer chair for an additional few days (first world problems, but nonetheless ). 

TLDR: Comfortable yet beautiful chair. Missing crucial tools/bolts in original packaging and had to contact customer service for a replacement.

title: Verve Chair in Mint
body: It is comfortable and was quite easy to put together. I would have preferred the base color be the same as the upholstery color. The base is a bit bright whereas the upholstery color is perfect!
full_review: Verve Chair in Mint: It is comfortable and was quite easy to put together. I would have preferred the base color be the same as the upholstery color. The base is a bit bright whereas the upholstery color is perfect!

title: Really great chair
body:
Love the new chair, lots of customizable settings, the arm rest are really nice, the lumbar cushion is a nice feature. The only thing I struggle with is the chair back is not fully customizable, it has a main setting and then you can set it to a pre-defined place, which in my case is a bit further than I would set it. Overall, it's a really great chair to work 8 hours a day. 

I recommend it.

The only thing I struggle with is the chair back is not fully customizable, it has a main setting and then you can set it to a pre-defined place, which in my case is a bit further than I would set it. Overall, it's a really great chair to work 8 hours a day. 

I recommend it.

body: Overall a good chair. I would give a 4.5 if I had an option. The bad: handles are a bit hard to maintain, occasionally by accident the reset. The seat is a little hard. No option for head placement.

title: So far so good
body: I just got this chair but so far I love it
full_review: So far so good: I just got this chair but so far I love it

title: Verve Chair experience
body:
Overall, an excellent chair built with quality materials, well-packaged and easy to assemble thanks to clear instructions and labeled parts. It's comfortable and offers a range of adjustments to tailor the fit.

The only reason I've given it 4 rather than 5 stars has to do with the arms. Although they adjust up and down, the chair would benefit from an additional front-back adjustment. I'm 6' 1" and the arms don't extend far enough forward to provide the arm support I'd prefer.
full_review:
Verve Chair experience: Overall, an excellent chair built with quality materials, well-packaged and easy to assemble thanks to clear instructions and labeled parts. It's comfortable and offers a range of adjustments to tailor the fit.

The only reason I've given it 4 rather than 5 stars has to do with the arms. Although they adjust up and down, the chair would benefit from an additional front-back adjustment. I'm 6' 1" and the arms don't extend far enough forward to provide the arm support I'd prefer.

title: Great chair, a little challenging to assemble
body:
My chair came quickly and had clear instructions for assembly. Unfortunately, getting the wheels on was challenging. Some of them popped into the star base farther than others, making the chair wobbly. It took a lot of effort to get all of the wheels into the base at a uniform height.

After that, however, putting the chair together was pretty easy and it is very sturdy and comfortable. Much more comfortable than the chair I’d been using. And, of course, it looks AMAZING!

Some of them popped into the star base farther than others, making the chair wobbly. It took a lot of effort to get all of the wheels into the base at a uniform height.

After that, however, putting the chair together was pretty easy and it is very sturdy and comfortable. Much more comfortable than the chair I’d been using. And, of course, it looks AMAZING!

title: It’s nice but….
body: I will have to say the chair is nice aesthetically, super easy to build on arrival. I had a few friends and family try it out also but the common denominator is the disappointment that this chair does not come with a head rest. I think for smaller stature people, no head rest is fine - so this is fine for me because I’m short. I just wish the seat was a bit softer because I find that my butt does begin to feel slightly sore after an 8 hour long work day.

title: Almost Amazing
body: Great customer service, a part arrived broken and a new shipment arrived within 2 days. The chair is great, very comfortable so far and looks great. Coming from a 6.1 tall person, I wish the back frame was a little taller as I feel the top frame when reclining.
full_review: Almost Amazing: Great customer service, a part arrived broken and a new shipment arrived within 2 days. The chair is great, very comfortable so far and looks great. Coming from a 6.1 tall person, I wish the back frame was a little taller as I feel the top frame when reclining.

title: Comfortable and very sturdy
body: The chair was simple to assemble and most of the parts are made of metal. It's a comfortable and a very sturdy chair with plenty of options to adjust (e.g. height, depth, lumbar support, arm rest height). I think the only thing that could be improved is adjusting the arms uses an awkward mechanism - pull them too high and they disengage and they fall back to the lowest setting.
full_review: Comfortable and very sturdy: The chair was simple to assemble and most of the parts are made of metal. It's a comfortable and a very sturdy chair with plenty of options to adjust (e.g. height, depth, lumbar support, arm rest height). I think the only thing that could be improved is adjusting the arms uses an awkward mechanism - pull them too high and they disengage and they fall back to the lowest setting.

title: Awesome chair but snags super easily!
body: First, this chair is awesome and sturdy and I would absolutely recommend it (and would buy it again). However, in less than 24 hours the cushion was snagged all over by kitty claws, just from them laying on it and moving around (they did not actively scratch). So just be aware of this. I now have to keep it covered when not in use, and I do not have to do this with other furniture. Took off one star for that.

I now have to keep it covered when not in use, and I do not have to do this with other furniture. Took off one star for that.

title: Armrests do not go down far enough.

title: Great for Shorter People
body:
I've loved the chair. It's not super tall in the back, which is great for shorter people. The lumbar support works well for shorter people as well. It's comfortable and cute. 
The arms are an area that could use some improvement. You have to actually try to count how many clicks you've pulled them up, otherwise the arms will drop back down to the base level. It's not super intuitive and hard to count the clicks. It's annoying and should be improved in future models. That is my only real complaint.
full_review:

title: Great Chair!
body: I was skeptical of buying the chair simply from reviews without being able to sit on it, or see it in person. However, I am in love with my chair now that it is physically here! I cannot say enough positive things about how comfortable the chair, and I felt like my lower back pain/tightness immediately disappeared when I sat in this chair. My only complaint is that Armrests for the chair do not lock in at different heights completely so sometimes when I am working my arm rests just fall all the way to lowest settings, and it can be jarring/annoying. I still recommend this chair though!

title: 4 Stars
body: The chair is very cute, and I love how it looks, which was the main reason I picked it over other cheaper chairs. It’s comfortable, and I like all the adjustment options. Like others have said tho, the arm rest adjustment mechanism is so flimsy. Also the lumbar support always slides down, and I have to readjust it every time I sit down. Overall though, it looks great, is comfy, has a lot of adjustments, but is just pricey for what it is.

title: Finally a beautiful and comfortable chair on the market.
body: Hi, I recently moved into a new apartment and adding the Coral Verve chair has brought so much life into the office! I was worried when I read the comments saying that it's not worth the price versus quality, I agree that the arms are annoying and unstable, low quality. Branch should fix this problem ASAP and not ignore the facts - but I still bought because I don't keep adjusting the arms - so it works perfect for me! The wheels are smooth, the chair is comfortable and supports my lower back well. It's hard to find a beautiful office chair that brings joy to your everyday life. So go ahead! You found one! There is nothing perfect, so lower one star to match your expectations. I recommend!

Branch should fix this problem ASAP and not ignore the facts - but I still bought because I don't keep adjusting the arms - so it works perfect for me! The wheels are smooth, the chair is comfortable and supports my lower back well. It's hard to find a beautiful office chair that brings joy to your everyday life. So go ahead! You found one! There is nothing perfect, so lower one star to match your expectations. I recommend!

body: I am enjoying my new Verve office chair from Branch. I could personally use slightly more lumbar support, and I wish I had also ordered the attachable neck support - I may still order it. This comfortable chair is easy to put together and adjust based on personal requirements.

body: I am very happy with the Verve chair, however, it could really use about 6 more inches of height adjustment. I would love to give it 5 stars but even at the highest setting it is too low for my frame. It's disappointing because I like everything else about the chair.

title: Great Chair
body: This is a great chair for me! This is no small thing as I often feel like one of the bears in Goldilocks and the Three Bears..."The first chair was too hard, the second too soft, but the third was just right". I have tried other more expensive brands but this chair works much better for me. The only thing I don't love are the arms. I find them too short and wish I could adjust them forward. Also, the locking mechanism takes some getting used to.

title: 4 Stars
body: I've used the chair for about a week now. It was easy to assemble and pretty comfortable. If I could adjust two things it would be that the chair post fits more snuggly in the roller piece to reduce wobble. I also sit pretty straight so it would be nice if the back came a little further forward or was a little taller. Overall I do really enjoy the chair.
full_review: 4 Stars: I've used the chair for about a week now. It was easy to assemble and pretty comfortable. If I could adjust two things it would be that the chair post fits more snuggly in the roller piece to reduce wobble. I also sit pretty straight so it would be nice if the back came a little further forward or was a little taller. Overall I do really enjoy the chair.

title: Good, odd arm adjustments.
body: The chair is good for the price, maybe slightly overpriced. Might expect it to come assembled. It is comfortable, provides good support, didn’t fatigue my core over multiple hours. Important to note that the backrest of the chair is a cloth mesh material, not a plastic. The arm rests are my only point of contention. In order to adjust, you pull them up, however you can’t move them down without pulling them to the max height and then starting from the lowest position again. In order to find your preferred height, you’ll have to count in your head how many “clicks” there are before reaching the top, and then moving to the one you liked the most. Basically, the arm rest height adjustment is not two ways. I bought this for my girlfriend, so I will use her height. She had the same opinions. Overall, satisfied.

title: Mostly Great, Besides a Few Features
body:
As a shorter guy (5' 7"), this chair looked like a good fit with all of the ergonomic features on top of a smaller footprint. As I'm getting into my late 30's, the gaming chair with zero support just wasn't cutting it anymore. The Verve overall looks great. The seat cushion is the perfect level of firmness, and the backrest has enough adjustment settings in terms of both tilt and pressure that I think most people can find a comfortable setting to use.

The couple of gripes I have are: 

1.) The armrests are pretty bad, as a lot of other reviews have indicated. They both feel and look flimsy, and are a pain to set to an optimal height. Can only move up and down, not forward/back or to the side to get them out of the way. There's no button, rather they are designed so that they fall all the way back down to their lowest position when you raise them past their highest adjustment point, which I feel is unintuitive and poorly thought out. The padding is also as thin as to be almost nonexistent; super firm and probably 1/16" thick. I understand they fit the minimalist aesthetic, but for how high end the rest of the chair feels I think improvements can be made here.

2.) The lumbar support is way too aggressive depth-wise, and the adjustment options (especially for a chair that's almost $600) are lackluster. Fortunately I don't suffer from any back issues, so I tried using it for a couple days figuring I just needed to get used to it. Whenever I found a decent position, it would slide back down when I shifted around too much. I had to modify the seat depth and the firmness of the backrest just so that it wouldn't feel like it was digging into my spine, and after two days of this I grabbed one of my right angle low profile screwdrivers and just took it off. They really need a depth option on this thing as everyone is built differently.

Overall I'm happy with this chair after my "DIY" adjustments. Who knows, maybe I just have the straightest lumbar in the world but know that it can be removed with some finagling if you have the right tools.
full_review:
Mostly Great, Besides a Few Features: As a shorter guy (5' 7"), this chair looked like a good fit with all of the ergonomic features on top of a smaller footprint. As I'm getting into my late 30's, the gaming chair with zero support just wasn't cutting it anymore. The Verve overall looks great. The seat cushion is the perfect level of firmness, and the backrest has enough adjustment settings in terms of both tilt and pressure that I think most people can find a comfortable setting to use.

The couple of gripes I have are: 

1.) The armrests are pretty bad, as a lot of other reviews have indicated. They both feel and look flimsy, and are a pain to set to an optimal height. Can only move up and down, not forward/back or to the side to get them out of the way. There's no button, rather they are designed so that they fall all the way back down to their lowest position when you raise them past their highest adjustment point, which I feel is unintuitive and poorly thought out. The padding is also as thin as to be almost nonexistent; super firm and probably 1/16" thick. I understand they fit the minimalist aesthetic, but for how high end the rest of the chair feels I think improvements can be made here.

2.) The lumbar support is way too aggressive depth-wise, and the adjustment options (especially for a chair that's almost $600) are lackluster. Fortunately I don't suffer from any back issues, so I tried using it for a couple days figuring I just needed to get used to it. Whenever I found a decent position, it would slide back down when I shifted around too much. I had to modify the seat depth and the firmness of the backrest just so that it wouldn't feel like it was digging into my spine, and after two days of this I grabbed one of my right angle low profile screwdrivers and just took it off. They really need a depth option on this thing as everyone is built differently.

Overall I'm happy with this chair after my "DIY" adjustments. Who knows, maybe I just have the straightest lumbar in the world but know that it can be removed with some finagling if you have the right tools.

title: Stellar chair overall, armrest construction- whoops
body: The chair is very comfortable, and the color and fabric is very attractive- a much better fit for our home than the Herman Miller options, which were nearly twice the price. Most adjustments feel just right. However, the armrests do not stay in position as advertised, and it would be quite nice to be able to tilt the seat up a bit.
full_review: Stellar chair overall, armrest construction- whoops: The chair is very comfortable, and the color and fabric is very attractive- a much better fit for our home than the Herman Miller options, which were nearly twice the price. Most adjustments feel just right. However, the armrests do not stay in position as advertised, and it would be quite nice to be able to tilt the seat up a bit.

title: Solid chair with a couple kinks
body: It's comfortable and adjustable. Assembly was quick and simple too. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the arm rests can be a bit finicky at times, but largely they do their job without issue. A problem that I personally ran into (and which I'm unsure whether it's a defect of the particular chair I got or a larger issue with the entire line) is that the adjustable lumbar won't stay in place, as it tends to slide down when put into higher positions. overall, I'm happy with it

title: Solid option, arms are a flaw
body: Nice design, sturdy, easy to assemble; arms don’t come up high enough and don’t adjust forward at all. Could use some longer/stronger lumbar support.
full_review: Solid option, arms are a flaw: Nice design, sturdy, easy to assemble; arms don’t come up high enough and don’t adjust forward at all. Could use some longer/stronger lumbar support.

body: Easy to build. Looks nice. Comfortable to sit in for long work days. Arm rest could be better but not a deal breaker for me (my last chair had only 1 arm rest that was even less customizable and the other broke off during a move). Upgraded from a more economical chair. Share this chair with my wife who's smaller than I am.

title: Great chair!
body: The chair is really great, just have two small issues. The seat tension is difficult to adjust and my arm rests wobble slightly
full_review: Great chair!: The chair is really great, just have two small issues. The seat tension is difficult to adjust and my arm rests wobble slightly

title: Great Chair, But Arms Need Redesign ASAP
body:
Overall, very happy with Branch from start to finish. Quick shipping, competitive pricing, and a very comfortable, adjustable chair that doesn’t break the bank. 

I work from home and wanted a more premium chair to support my posture and backside and the Verve delivers. I had a small warranty issue that Branch was lightning fast to resolve and I was so impressed with the customer service and troubleshooting. 

That said, the Verve’s Achilles heel are the arms. I don’t know what designers were thinking. I was willing to sacrifice the forward/backward adjustability vs the Ergonomic model since this chair was reviewed to be more comfortable, but even though they “click” about 9 positions up and down, no matter how tight you install them, they wiggle like a $30 chair from a bargain retailer and it completely distracts from how good this chair is in every other category. 

I am begging Branch to develop an arm accessory kit that fixes how wobbly and poorly designed the current arms are. I would happily pay to replace them if it meant getting sturdier, steadier arms. Also, a headrest would be great. 

Overall, this chair was worth the money to me but the arms would’ve been a deal breaker to me if I had known how wobbly they were. I do also wish the height went up a little further- it feels a bit low even at the highest setting. If I could do it all over again, I’d probably have gone with the Ergonomic Chair, but the Verve is one adjustment away from being a fantastic chair and Branch has been a great company to do business with - highly recommend!

I am begging Branch to develop an arm accessory kit that fixes how wobbly and poorly designed the current arms are. I would happily pay to replace them if it meant getting sturdier, steadier arms. Also, a headrest would be great. 

Overall, this chair was worth the money to me but the arms would’ve been a deal breaker to me if I had known how wobbly they were. I do also wish the height went up a little further- it feels a bit low even at the highest setting. If I could do it all over again, I’d probably have gone with the Ergonomic Chair, but the Verve is one adjustment away from being a fantastic chair and Branch has been a great company to do business with - highly recommend!

title: Really Nice Chair Overall!
body:
I've had the chair for about three weeks now, and overall it is much better than my previous office chair, which I bought at Sam's Club. My back and legs are not tight or achy like they were in the other chair. 

The Verve was really easy to assemble and is mostly comfortable. My only wish is that the seat cushion was a little less firm, as my bottom sometimes gets a little sore. Some days I'm in the chair for 3-4 hours straight, 

But considering that the "perfect" chair would have likely cost twice as much or more, I'm very happy with the purchase. I just have to try and get up more often.

title: Good chair for the price!
body: The chair is very comfortable, and well worth the price. My only complaint about the chair are the arm rests. I do not like how micro the adjustments are. It makes it very hard to find the exact spot you want. I also wish the arm rests could move out and in, and not just up and down. Everything else is great!

It makes it very hard to find the exact spot you want. I also wish the arm rests could move out and in, and not just up and down. Everything else is great!

title: Disappointed
body: Overall for the money, I am disappointed. I find it difficult to use the tilt mechanism - it is not as smooth as the video suggests. And the arms are very wobbly - when locked into a position they move back and forth.
full_review: Disappointed: Overall for the money, I am disappointed. I find it difficult to use the tilt mechanism - it is not as smooth as the video suggests. And the arms are very wobbly - when locked into a position they move back and forth.

title: Perfect for my size! (except one detail)
body:
I've been struggling with lower back pain and found the need to switch up to an ergonomic chair with a good lumbar support. As soon as the chair got here, we pieced it together. The seat, the mesh back and the fit felt perfect! For someone petite (5'2") this chair felt perfect for my size. 

The only reason I am putting 4/5 starts is the lumbar support. It was what was most necessary for my condition, and I found that the chair's lumbar support goes up only so much. At it's highest setting it hit the lower part of my spine and made it uncomfortable. It is too low in my perspective. And I wished there was a way to move it higher. At its lowest setting, I can't imagine anyone sitting on it, unless they have no arc in their back.

While I researched more chairs, I realized I didn't like any out there, and this was almost perfect except for the lumbar support. So while it was tricky, my husband found a way to remove it, and the mesh alone is of much support and way more comfortable for my natural arc. So I kept it, but had to remove that part.

title: Great chair! A few improvements suggested
body: Overall this chair is good looking and very comfortable. I like all the adjustability. The only thing I would change is making the arms more adjustable, I can’t actually raise them high enough to support my elbows. I’m 5’11” for reference. Also I agree with other reviewers that the mechanism for adjusting the arms is annoying, it would be better to be able to adjust all the way to the top of the range without having them drop back down.
full_review: Great chair! A few improvements suggested: Overall this chair is good looking and very comfortable. I like all the adjustability. The only thing I would change is making the arms more adjustable, I can’t actually raise them high enough to support my elbows. I’m 5’11” for reference. Also I agree with other reviewers that the mechanism for adjusting the arms is annoying, it would be better to be able to adjust all the way to the top of the range without having them drop back down.

title: Almost Exactly what I wanted in a Chair
body:
I was looking for a new chair to help with my 3 herniated discs and this one has done quite well for me. Even at my height I found no issues adjusting this chair to be comfortable and supportive. The best features are the insanely thick aluminum body pieces. This chair is Very sturdy and I don't ever feel unstable or that It will tip over or fall apart. Due to its simple construction of large sturdy aluminum blocks I really cant see wear and tear happening as fast to this chair as some of the others I have used in the past.

While the arm rests are easy enough to get used to I saw a lot of complaints about the height adjustment. I don't really mind the height setting at all, its not ideal but it works pretty well, I've only accidently reset the heights 2 or 3 times in a month. I wish there was a different solution to the arms altogether. They seem very cheap and almost flimsy compared to the build quality of the rest of the chair and seem to fit somewhat loosely so they have a bit of play in them. Im not the biggest fan of the pads on the arm rests either. sometimes they are a bit too hard, but I only rest my elbows on them, so that may differ from other peoples experience.

The back support slider on the back in my opinion seems to be pretty useless I dont ever really feel it, and it never stays in place.

All in all, Im glad I bought this chair. It was easy to set up just like they said it would be, and its simple yet fully featured. Step out of your comfort zone and get the coral one too.

This chair is Very sturdy and I don't ever feel unstable or that It will tip over or fall apart. Due to its simple construction of large sturdy aluminum blocks I really cant see wear and tear happening as fast to this chair as some of the others I have used in the past.

While the arm rests are easy enough to get used to I saw a lot of complaints about the height adjustment. I don't really mind the height setting at all, its not ideal but it works pretty well, I've only accidently reset the heights 2 or 3 times in a month. I wish there was a different solution to the arms altogether. They seem very cheap and almost flimsy compared to the build quality of the rest of the chair and seem to fit somewhat loosely so they have a bit of play in them. Im not the biggest fan of the pads on the arm rests either. sometimes they are a bit too hard, but I only rest my elbows on them, so that may differ from other peoples experience.

The back support slider on the back in my opinion seems to be pretty useless I dont ever really feel it, and it never stays in place.

All in all, Im glad I bought this chair. It was easy to set up just like they said it would be, and its simple yet fully featured. Step out of your comfort zone and get the coral one too.

title: Great Chair, A Few Minor Annoyances
body: Great chair. Love the minimalist, modern look, the low profile, comfort, and the tilt. There are two minor issues. First, the seat height. There is a discrepancy in their published specs regarding the lowest seat height. The product page says the seat can go down to 16.5" and the downloadable spec sheet says it can go down to 17." I reported this to their support team weeks ago and they still have not updated it with the correct information. Even so, the lowest height my chair will go is 18." It's "good enough" but I'm 5'4" and my feet without shoes barely lay flat on the ground. Given that their brand so heavily leans on their ergonomic design, and this chair is marketed to people who are 5'0", it's surprising to me that they aren't as conscious of the details like making sure the construction of the chair actually goes down low enough for 5'0" people and that there are discrepancies in their published specs that they don't update quickly. Second, the arms are finicky to change heights. I tend to switch up the height depending on whether I'm leaning back, or if I'm upright at the desk. It seems that they were trying to make the function of the arms super minimalistic, which is a nice idea, but the execution was sub par. I'd rather have the "click and lock" at each step, so I know it's in place vs. a sleeker design that doesn't work as well.

Given that their brand so heavily leans on their ergonomic design, and this chair is marketed to people who are 5'0", it's surprising to me that they aren't as conscious of the details like making sure the construction of the chair actually goes down low enough for 5'0" people and that there are discrepancies in their published specs that they don't update quickly. Second, the arms are finicky to change heights. I tend to switch up the height depending on whether I'm leaning back, or if I'm upright at the desk. It seems that they were trying to make the function of the arms super minimalistic, which is a nice idea, but the execution was sub par. I'd rather have the "click and lock" at each step, so I know it's in place vs. a sleeker design that doesn't work as well.

title: Almost perfect
body: This chair is definitely a splurge but give the need for a well functioning office set up I got this chair. My two main issues are how annoying it is to lock the armrests in place and lack of a seat tilt. Though I can sit with me feet on the floor, I still have to elevate my legs to not feel like im falling forward. I think if you were able to adjust the seat tilt then it would work for more women who need to tuck their pelvis.
full_review: Almost perfect: This chair is definitely a splurge but give the need for a well functioning office set up I got this chair. My two main issues are how annoying it is to lock the armrests in place and lack of a seat tilt. Though I can sit with me feet on the floor, I still have to elevate my legs to not feel like im falling forward. I think if you were able to adjust the seat tilt then it would work for more women who need to tuck their pelvis.

title: Sleek and modern looking desk chair
body: This is overall, quite a comfortable chair. The arm rests adjust up and down very easily, and the chair has a nice tilt/rocking feature. Would be nice if it had a little bit more lumbar cushion/support, and a headrest, but overall, I quite like it, and it looks quite modern in my office.
full_review: Sleek and modern looking desk chair: This is overall, quite a comfortable chair. The arm rests adjust up and down very easily, and the chair has a nice tilt/rocking feature. Would be nice if it had a little bit more lumbar cushion/support, and a headrest, but overall, I quite like it, and it looks quite modern in my office.

title: Love This Chair!!!
body: I absolutely love my Verve chair! This is the most comfortable and solid chair I've owned. I bought it in Coral for a pop of color in my office. I had spinal surgery a couple of years ago and I had been looking for a chair that would allow me to sit at my desk and work for several hours at a time without pain. With my previous "ergonomic" chair, I had to use multiple pillows to support my back but it would still hurt. The Verve chair allows me to perfectly position each setting so it is extremely comfortable for my back. My family thought I was going a little overboard with the price of this chair. But once they had a chance to sit in it, they understood why I decided to spend the money. Each person commented on the high quality of the material and how comfortable it is. I would suggest to the designers, to have a better way to lock the armrests in place. When I grab the armrest to pull my chair up to my desk, it releases the armrest height setting. Otherwise, I highly recommend this chair, plus it's also really beautiful.

I had spinal surgery a couple of years ago and I had been looking for a chair that would allow me to sit at my desk and work for several hours at a time without pain. With my previous "ergonomic" chair, I had to use multiple pillows to support my back but it would still hurt. The Verve chair allows me to perfectly position each setting so it is extremely comfortable for my back. My family thought I was going a little overboard with the price of this chair. But once they had a chance to sit in it, they understood why I decided to spend the money. Each person commented on the high quality of the material and how comfortable it is. I would suggest to the designers, to have a better way to lock the armrests in place. When I grab the armrest to pull my chair up to my desk, it releases the armrest height setting. Otherwise, I highly recommend this chair, plus it's also really beautiful.

title: Comfy but not perfect
body: The chair is super comfortable. However, I wish the back was higher and/or it came with a head rest. I’m only 5’5” and have a short torso and it feels awkwardly short, even after adjusting the seat.
full_review: Comfy but not perfect: The chair is super comfortable. However, I wish the back was higher and/or it came with a head rest. I’m only 5’5” and have a short torso and it feels awkwardly short, even after adjusting the seat.

title: Worth the money!
body: The Verve is a noticeable improvement over my previous gaming-styled chair. Once adjusted to your liking, it can be comfortably sat in for hours. It is of solid construction and looks great in my room! However, the armrests are quite firm, sometimes uncomfortably so over extended periods. Otherwise, it is a great chair and worth its price. Recommended!

body: Great comfort and adjustable - to an extent. It's a tad too short for my 5'10" frame and does not extend any higher. Would consider another option if you are tall.

title: Verve Chair review
body: Chair feels very sturdy and well built. Material fabric feels nice and soft! I deducted one star because the chair doesn't feel soft and forces me to get up or stand every once in a while. I also think that for the value of this chair, it should have came with a head rest, which I heard is coming out in 2023, so it looks like I'll need to spend extra money for this add on.

body: The coral color is perfect! My lowback is now happy and I love that I can adjust the chair easily. I was disappointed when my first command was lost in transit, but the team stayed in touch with me at every step, witch was reassuring.

title: Wonderful Chair
body: I am a student and spend atleast 6 hours a day in my chair. The Verve is a beautiful chair. Very easy to set up. Sturdy and quiet. Plush, comfortable seat. Lovely knitted back of the chair, feels special. The adjustments are everything. I love that you can adjust the seat position and the tension of the chair tilt. Only negative is non-adjustable arm rests (only move up and down and sometimes don’t adjust easily). If Branch would update the arm rests I would make it a 5*****!

title: Lost a star for no optional headrest.
body: Love the chair. Good look. Comfy. Good options. Wish it had headrest.
full_review: Lost a star for no optional headrest.: Love the chair. Good look. Comfy. Good options. Wish it had headrest.

title: Great chair!
body: I really like this chair. It's comfortable for long periods, and the adjustable lumbar support is awesome. Contruction is solid and I'm sure it will last a good long while. But I had to dock a star for the armrests. They're a bit too "form over function". They're a little too narrow, and the pads are barely pads at all so your arms tend to roll on them. Easily fixed with some arm rest pads from Amazon. But other than that small quibble, it's a great chair.

But I had to dock a star for the armrests. They're a bit too "form over function". They're a little too narrow, and the pads are barely pads at all so your arms tend to roll on them. Easily fixed with some arm rest pads from Amazon. But other than that small quibble, it's a great chair.

title: Comfortable & supportive but double check the height before buying
body:
I purchased 2x of these chairs for me and my husband. 

Pros:
The chairs are very comfortable and supportive, and offers many ways to adjust the chair to each of our personal preferences. We choose the white colour which is mostly white with light grey seats. 

Cons:
The chair only range in height from 16.5"-20.5" (seat height). This may be industry standards (?) but it sadly made the chair too short for us to sit comfortable at our build-in desk which is 31" in height (for reference we are 5'4 and 5'9) - I ended up purchasing new taller wheels in order to increase the size of the chair in order to avoid having to return the chairs and pay for return shipping), so make sure you check the height of your desk before buying.

title: Verve Chair a little short
body: I like the chair for all the typical comfort and quality. The only issue is that it is a little short for my standard commercial desk. If it could be 2” taller, it would be perfect.
full_review: Verve Chair a little short: I like the chair for all the typical comfort and quality. The only issue is that it is a little short for my standard commercial desk. If it could be 2” taller, it would be perfect.

title: Verve Chair Review
body: Chair is decent. Would prefer if arms didn't lift/lower so easily (i.e. on a ratcheted design rather than slide) because I find myself accidentally moving them too often. The reason I bought it was because the seat depth is adjustable; I'm small, there are very few chairs on the market that can be 18" depth. Will see how the padding holds up; found it a little too firm for me. The salmon colour is fun, exactly as pictured (altho that colour will probably be dated soon from a design perspective). Would have gone with the grey if it wasn't so light (will show every mark), but black is just too boring!

Would prefer if arms didn't lift/lower so easily (i.e. on a ratcheted design rather than slide) because I find myself accidentally moving them too often. The reason I bought it was because the seat depth is adjustable; I'm small, there are very few chairs on the market that can be 18" depth. Will see how the padding holds up; found it a little too firm for me. The salmon colour is fun, exactly as pictured (altho that colour will probably be dated soon from a design perspective). Would have gone with the grey if it wasn't so light (will show every mark), but black is just too boring!

title: Almost there--
body:
3.5 / 5

This is a high quality and attractive chair. I think this would be a better fit for some one a bit bigger than my 5'2" and with broader shoulders. I wish I could make the armrests more narrow, my elbows have to go a bit wider than they naturally fall. I'm not a huge fan of the mechanism that raises/lowers the armrests--if you accidentally pull up on the arm, you can't lower the height.

As for the lumbar support, it's a little aggressive for my taste. My back hurts a bit, and I *think* it's because I'm forced to have a very upright posture and my back muscles are kinda weak. Not the worst thing in the world, but not the most comfy for me.

Overall I'm not disappointed in the purchase, but for the price it could be better in terms of the actual ergonomics. Definitely couldn't find a more attractive chair, though.

As for the lumbar support, it's a little aggressive for my taste. My back hurts a bit, and I *think* it's because I'm forced to have a very upright posture and my back muscles are kinda weak. Not the worst thing in the world, but not the most comfy for me.

Overall I'm not disappointed in the purchase, but for the price it could be better in terms of the actual ergonomics. Definitely couldn't find a more attractive chair, though.

title: Good chair, a bit pricey and not ideal if you are tall
body: The chair is comfortable and allows for a few different adjustments which is nice but it’s a bit pricey. I think you can get something not quite as nice but for considerably less. Also, I am 6’2” and the highest setting is not ideal. If it could go up another couple inches it would be much better.
full_review: Good chair, a bit pricey and not ideal if you are tall: The chair is comfortable and allows for a few different adjustments which is nice but it’s a bit pricey. I think you can get something not quite as nice but for considerably less. Also, I am 6’2” and the highest setting is not ideal. If it could go up another couple inches it would be much better.

title: Super Comfortable
body: This chair is gorgeous and very comfortable. Assembly was quite easy. I deducted one start because the arms on this chair seem cheaply made for the overall price of the chair. They're adjustable, but only up and down. They rattle and are loose feeling. They're also very hard.
full_review: Super Comfortable: This chair is gorgeous and very comfortable. Assembly was quite easy. I deducted one start because the arms on this chair seem cheaply made for the overall price of the chair. They're adjustable, but only up and down. They rattle and are loose feeling. They're also very hard.

title: Handsome, Comfortable, Easy to Assemble
body: It's a very good chair. It looks great, well suited to a home office. The seat is comfortable, and the fabric of the back is excellent (with just the right amount of "spring" to it). It is easy to adjust, and, accordingly, easy to find a comfortable position. The quick assembly is a bonus. There were two reasons I withheld one star, giving only four instead of five: (1) it only comes in three colors; and (2) the arms -- which look great, design-wise -- have a bit too much play in them (i.e., they could be sturdier).
full_review: Handsome, Comfortable, Easy to Assemble: It's a very good chair. It looks great, well suited to a home office. The seat is comfortable, and the fabric of the back is excellent (with just the right amount of "spring" to it). It is easy to adjust, and, accordingly, easy to find a comfortable position. The quick assembly is a bonus. There were two reasons I withheld one star, giving only four instead of five: (1) it only comes in three colors; and (2) the arms -- which look great, design-wise -- have a bit too much play in them (i.e., they could be sturdier).

title: Great chair
body: Was in need of a new desk chair for my home office and really loved the look of the Verve chair. Went into one of Branch's showrooms to try out the different options, and although I liked the arm rests on the Ergonomic chair more (more stable and a less finicky mechanism for raising/lowering the arm rests), I liked the size and feeling of the Verve chair best. Been using it for a couple weeks now, usually sitting for 2-3 hours at a time and find it way more comfortable than my previous chair. I have a fair bit of lower back pain and I haven't experienced as many flare ups sitting in my new chair.
full_review: Great chair: Was in need of a new desk chair for my home office and really loved the look of the Verve chair. Went into one of Branch's showrooms to try out the different options, and although I liked the arm rests on the Ergonomic chair more (more stable and a less finicky mechanism for raising/lowering the arm rests), I liked the size and feeling of the Verve chair best. Been using it for a couple weeks now, usually sitting for 2-3 hours at a time and find it way more comfortable than my previous chair. I have a fair bit of lower back pain and I haven't experienced as many flare ups sitting in my new chair.

title: So far so good!
body:
This is my first ergonomic chair. 
Pros: easy to assemble; very sturdy and moves smoothly; seat is very comfy; cute design, looks nice in my room.
Cons: the armrest is not really "padded", feels thin, and the adjustment feels shaky; and I really wish I can buy a headrest of the same material and color
full_review:
So far so good!: This is my first ergonomic chair. 
Pros: easy to assemble; very sturdy and moves smoothly; seat is very comfy; cute design, looks nice in my room.
Cons: the armrest is not really "padded", feels thin, and the adjustment feels shaky; and I really wish I can buy a headrest of the same material and color

title: Great value
body: This is a great chair, especially for the price. It's pretty, comfortable and feels like great quality. However, I am 5 feet tall which is in the height range advertised for this chair, but on the lowest setting it's a bit too tall. I am using a foot rest to compensate for this but wish it went lower.
full_review: Great value: This is a great chair, especially for the price. It's pretty, comfortable and feels like great quality. However, I am 5 feet tall which is in the height range advertised for this chair, but on the lowest setting it's a bit too tall. I am using a foot rest to compensate for this but wish it went lower.

title: It's pretty good
body: The chair is easy to assemble, feels sturdy. Comfortable and looks beautiful. The only thing I wish I could change is the max height. I wish the seat max height is a couple inches taller.
full_review: It's pretty good: The chair is easy to assemble, feels sturdy. Comfortable and looks beautiful. The only thing I wish I could change is the max height. I wish the seat max height is a couple inches taller.

title: Lovely, comfortable chair
body: I purchased the Verve chair in the coral color and it is just gorgeous. I didn't have too much trouble assembling it. It's very comfortable and easy to adjust. Overall, I'm very happy with the chair. I was just slightly annoyed that the legs of the chair came with the paint chipped, due to poor protection during shipping. It's not too noticeable though, so I let it go. At this price point, the chair should probably arrive in perfect condition. Still, I'm happy with it.
full_review: Lovely, comfortable chair: I purchased the Verve chair in the coral color and it is just gorgeous. I didn't have too much trouble assembling it. It's very comfortable and easy to adjust. Overall, I'm very happy with the chair. I was just slightly annoyed that the legs of the chair came with the paint chipped, due to poor protection during shipping. It's not too noticeable though, so I let it go. At this price point, the chair should probably arrive in perfect condition. Still, I'm happy with it.

title: Good, solid chair with nice look
body: Really easy to assemble, looks good and is as sold. I gave 4stars instead of five for two reasons: price point is very high compared to similar chairs and the arm adjustment is a bit cheap and often I cannot get both sides to click and hold at the same height as a result.
full_review: Good, solid chair with nice look: Really easy to assemble, looks good and is as sold. I gave 4stars instead of five for two reasons: price point is very high compared to similar chairs and the arm adjustment is a bit cheap and often I cannot get both sides to click and hold at the same height as a result.

title: Great quality, but could be improved with greater height range or a 'big and tall' option
body:
Love the look and feel of the chair, and it was super easy to assemble. Really appreciate all of the adjustments available, especially the tilt resistance control. 

Very minor concern: it feels like it's maybe a little bit short for me. I'm 6'2 and have long legs (34 inseam) and even after lifting seat to full height still felt like it was lower to the ground than I normally like, though my legs aren't far off from a 90-degree angle, so perhaps I need to give it a little more time to see if I've just set chairs to the wrong height all these years :). Lumbar support felt OK but wish it went up just a bit higher.
full_review:
Great quality, but could be improved with greater height range or a 'big and tall' option: Love the look and feel of the chair, and it was super easy to assemble. Really appreciate all of the adjustments available, especially the tilt resistance control. 

Very minor concern: it feels like it's maybe a little bit short for me. I'm 6'2 and have long legs (34 inseam) and even after lifting seat to full height still felt like it was lower to the ground than I normally like, though my legs aren't far off from a 90-degree angle, so perhaps I need to give it a little more time to see if I've just set chairs to the wrong height all these years :). Lumbar support felt OK but wish it went up just a bit higher.

title: Great chair!
body: This chair is very comfortable. Cushioning is great! It isn’t as adjustable as the Aerons but it gets very close and feels just as comfortable. This chair has around 5 or so settings for each adjustment rather than a continuous setting found in the Aerons. I also feel this chair encourages a better posture than the Aerons. As a point of reference, I’m a 6’ 2”, 220lbs guy. Minus one star because the chair came in a little dirty so had to clean it and the lack of a headrest (or even the option to buy one). I’d forgive the dirtiness if they would have included a headrest or had the option to add. This chair would have been way better with a headrest. To the Branch folks, please add a headrest option!
full_review: Great chair!: This chair is very comfortable. Cushioning is great! It isn’t as adjustable as the Aerons but it gets very close and feels just as comfortable. This chair has around 5 or so settings for each adjustment rather than a continuous setting found in the Aerons. I also feel this chair encourages a better posture than the Aerons. As a point of reference, I’m a 6’ 2”, 220lbs guy. Minus one star because the chair came in a little dirty so had to clean it and the lack of a headrest (or even the option to buy one). I’d forgive the dirtiness if they would have included a headrest or had the option to add. This chair would have been way better with a headrest. To the Branch folks, please add a headrest option!

title: Huge upgrade
body: I've been sitting in an uncomfortable chair for years, and been eyeing the Branch chairs. When I saw they were releasing the verve chair with an all coral option, I finally pulled the trigger and preordered. Overall I'm really happy with it, and it's very comfy. My only complaints are that the cushions came dirty -- some kind of black smudges on them. I got them off for the most part but kind of a bummer. And the knob that allows you to adjust the resistance of the recline is really tough to turn. Other than I love it!!!
full_review: Huge upgrade: I've been sitting in an uncomfortable chair for years, and been eyeing the Branch chairs. When I saw they were releasing the verve chair with an all coral option, I finally pulled the trigger and preordered. Overall I'm really happy with it, and it's very comfy. My only complaints are that the cushions came dirty -- some kind of black smudges on them. I got them off for the most part but kind of a bummer. And the knob that allows you to adjust the resistance of the recline is really tough to turn. Other than I love it!!!

title: Sturdy build and comfortable, average armrests
body: Overall this is a great office chair - feels really sturdy and is comfortable. I am also a big fan of the back material, which is slightly stretchy but also supportive and breathable. I only wish the armrests were more adjustable and more padded (elbows can get sore). It also would be nice if a headrest was offered as an add-on like Branch’s ergonomic chair.
full_review: Sturdy build and comfortable, average armrests: Overall this is a great office chair - feels really sturdy and is comfortable. I am also a big fan of the back material, which is slightly stretchy but also supportive and breathable. I only wish the armrests were more adjustable and more padded (elbows can get sore). It also would be nice if a headrest was offered as an add-on like Branch’s ergonomic chair.

title: I like it... but still deciding if it is the right chair for me.
body:
Quality materials. Built well and looks really nice. The comfort is... okay. I am 6' 2", and I feel like the chair is built for someone below 6-foot. Maybe 5' 10" max.

The chair has a good number of adjustable parts to "find the right fit", but I sort of feel like range each of these parts are adjustable to a point that is just outside of where I want them to be. For example, I wish the lumbar support could go a couple notches lower to help my lower back in instances when I need to lean forward over my Cintiq monitor while drawing. I wish the lean-back resistance of the chair was slightly stronger for bigger dudes like me. I also wish the resistance when locked upright was a little stronger with less give (but that's minor). 

I wish the arm rests could slide forward (and even rotate diagonally left and right). Even when the chair seat is slid all the way back, the arms are still too far back, and are mostly just supporting my elbows and a bit of my forearms. I bought some extra-padded arm cushions off Amazon that you can velcro around the arms, and that  has helped the situation, since the padding on the Verve arm rests are not that comfortable anyway. However, I realize that if my forearms were actually able to sit on the arm rests properly, the default padding might actually be fine. If all your arm weight distribution has to go to your elbows for support, then no.

When it comes to padding, I'm also not sure if the seat cushion is as comfortable as it could be. I wish it was a little thicker to be a bit softer on the bum.

My last annoyance is that the chair back cannot adjust in height. My shoulders rise above the chair seat height. If I force myself to lay my shoulders all the way back on the chair,  it kinda works, but I feel like the back should be maybe an inch or two higher for me. Now with that said, I did not purchase the head rest. I've thought about purchasing one, but I'm not sure if it will actually reach my head. My worry is that it will come up only high enough that when I put my head back, the top of the headrest will just dig into the back of my skull.  Maybe it would come up higher than I think though.

I'm seeing this Ergonomic Chair Pro coming out, and I'm wondering if that is the chair I should get (or have gotten). I really want to try one out and see if it is a better solution for me than the Verve.

As said from the beginning, I really love the quality of these Branch chairs for the materials used and the design and engineering put into them.  I feel like they are built to last.

Comfort level is where I'm having issues. The chair to a certain extent is still somewhat comfortable, but I will need to be in this chair on some days for more than 8 hours.

So, for this tall guy, I'm still not sure if the Verve is the best chair for me.

The chair has a good number of adjustable parts to "find the right fit", but I sort of feel like range each of these parts are adjustable to a point that is just outside of where I want them to be. For example, I wish the lumbar support could go a couple notches lower to help my lower back in instances when I need to lean forward over my Cintiq monitor while drawing. I wish the lean-back resistance of the chair was slightly stronger for bigger dudes like me. I also wish the resistance when locked upright was a little stronger with less give (but that's minor). 

I wish the arm rests could slide forward (and even rotate diagonally left and right). Even when the chair seat is slid all the way back, the arms are still too far back, and are mostly just supporting my elbows and a bit of my forearms. I bought some extra-padded arm cushions off Amazon that you can velcro around the arms, and that  has helped the situation, since the padding on the Verve arm rests are not that comfortable anyway. However, I realize that if my forearms were actually able to sit on the arm rests properly, the default padding might actually be fine. If all your arm weight distribution has to go to your elbows for support, then no.

When it comes to padding, I'm also not sure if the seat cushion is as comfortable as it could be. I wish it was a little thicker to be a bit softer on the bum.

My last annoyance is that the chair back cannot adjust in height. My shoulders rise above the chair seat height. If I force myself to lay my shoulders all the way back on the chair,  it kinda works, but I feel like the back should be maybe an inch or two higher for me. Now with that said, I did not purchase the head rest. I've thought about purchasing one, but I'm not sure if it will actually reach my head. I'm seeing this Ergonomic Chair Pro coming out, and I'm wondering if that is the chair I should get (or have gotten). I really want to try one out and see if it is a better solution for me than the Verve.

As said from the beginning, I really love the quality of these Branch chairs for the materials used and the design and engineering put into them.  I feel like they are built to last.

Comfort level is where I'm having issues. The chair to a certain extent is still somewhat comfortable, but I will need to be in this chair on some days for more than 8 hours.

So, for this tall guy, I'm still not sure if the Verve is the best chair for me.

title: Install Problems
body: Install was very difficult.
full_review: Install Problems: Install was very difficult.

title: Small chair
body: Just okay. I've sat in many chairs. This one feels small. It also looks small at my executive desk. I recommend this chair for someone smaller who sits at a less substantial desk. The adjustments are great and it's comfortable. The only adjustment I cannot tune in is height. I won't be able to use this chair, but someone at my office can.
full_review: Small chair: Just okay. I've sat in many chairs. This one feels small. It also looks small at my executive desk. I recommend this chair for someone smaller who sits at a less substantial desk. The adjustments are great and it's comfortable. The only adjustment I cannot tune in is height. I won't be able to use this chair, but someone at my office can.

title: Well-built but not for the tall
body: This seems solidly built, but it is definitely best for those under 6'. At 6' 1" (& normally fit things that those that others 6' find OK), this is at it's limit for fit. I wish it went @ 1/2" higher, came forward @ 1" more, back came @ 1-2" higher, & lumbar support adjusted @ 1-1.5" higher. The optional headrest is totally useless, as it doesn't come nearly high enough to support the head. I doubt it will be a keeper due to just being at the limit of fit in almost all adjustments. Your mileage may very. It's definitely attractive, so I had hope.

title: Fabric quickly unraveled
body: Within a week of using the chair, the fabric on the seat has a thread that is pulled out. Only have 3 days from purchase to request replacement or refund, so SOL.
full_review: Fabric quickly unraveled: Within a week of using the chair, the fabric on the seat has a thread that is pulled out. Only have 3 days from purchase to request replacement or refund, so SOL.

title: Don't purchase without trying it first
body: I purchased this based only on reviews without trying it first. Big mistake. I have a Herman Miller Aeron Chair but wanted something that was equally ergonomic and adjustable without being as hard and industrial looking. The physical specifications and height adjustment range of the two chairs are similar, but after assembling the Verve Chair, I simply could not get the seat to rise as high as the Aeron. You really sink into the Verve whereas you are more propped up on the Aeron. Using a tape measure with both chairs at their maximum height, the Verve is 2-3 inches lower than the Aeron. Now I have to figure out how to send it back.

Now I have to figure out how to send it back.

title: Not as adjustable as expected
body: I find the chair suitable for people who are average size or smaller, but if you’re a bit taller or wider than the average person, the chair easily becomes uncomfortable as it does not provide enough adjustment levels
full_review: Not as adjustable as expected: I find the chair suitable for people who are average size or smaller, but if you’re a bit taller or wider than the average person, the chair easily becomes uncomfortable as it does not provide enough adjustment levels

title: Just doesn’t feel right
body: I rarely ever review negatively, but Branch kept asking for review. I saw lots of great reviews on the chair which prompted me to order one. Easy to install and looks great, but the seat just doesn’t feel right. No amount of adjustment seems to fix it. My lower back aches often and not being able to incline the seat at an angle just bothers my knees. Very frustrated with the chair.
full_review: Just doesn’t feel right: I rarely ever review negatively, but Branch kept asking for review. I saw lots of great reviews on the chair which prompted me to order one. Easy to install and looks great, but the seat just doesn’t feel right. No amount of adjustment seems to fix it. My lower back aches often and not being able to incline the seat at an angle just bothers my knees. Very frustrated with the chair.

title: Chair is small
body: I bought this chair 6 months ago. My issue is that the chair is tiny. As a 6ft 200lb man (muscular, not fat) I barely fit in the chair. There is not enough back support as the chair ends below my shoulder blades. It is tight when I sit in it. I feel like I am sitting in a tiny persons chair. This chair is meant for a girl that is at max 5ft 5inch tall. Other than the chair being tiny everything else is good.
