There is not enough back support as the chair ends below my shoulder blades. It is tight when I sit in it. I feel like I am sitting in a tiny persons chair. This chair is meant for a girl that is at max 5ft 5inch tall. Other than the chair being tiny everything else is good.

title: Looks great, feels okay
body: I love how it looks more than I thought I would, but it doesn’t go quite high enough for my arms to be level with the desk (I’m short and short-torsoed). The lumbar support is much better than other chairs I’ve tried but I also wish it went a tad higher. It also slides down a lot which is annoying. The seat cushion is very comfy though and it was super easy to assemble. Anyway, it’s a nice chair but I guess for the price point I’m mildly disappointed. But I’m small, it probably fits a normal-sized human better.
full_review: Looks great, feels okay: I love how it looks more than I thought I would, but it doesn’t go quite high enough for my arms to be level with the desk (I’m short and short-torsoed). The lumbar support is much better than other chairs I’ve tried but I also wish it went a tad higher. It also slides down a lot which is annoying. The seat cushion is very comfy though and it was super easy to assemble. Anyway, it’s a nice chair but I guess for the price point I’m mildly disappointed. But I’m small, it probably fits a normal-sized human better.

title: mediocre comfort
body: The chair is mediocre in terms of seat and back comfort. I replaced my old home office chair (a way cheaper one from Office Depot) with this, and this was twice the price and a downgrade comfort. Seems you’re paying more for the looks than function.
full_review: mediocre comfort: The chair is mediocre in terms of seat and back comfort. I replaced my old home office chair (a way cheaper one from Office Depot) with this, and this was twice the price and a downgrade comfort. Seems you’re paying more for the looks than function.

title: Not nearly as comfortable as expected.
body: Everyone saying this chair puts other office chairs to shame has never sat in a comfortable office chair. The chair padding is of mediocre quality, I expected so much more from it for the price. I sat in a $50 desk chair at Home Goods the other week and it was 1,000 times more comfortable than the verve. The verve only lifts to 20.5” which is lower than the average desk chair. I’m 6 foot 185Lbs and thought it would be enough but falls way short. And it’s as if one is sitting on a very firm surface. The lumbar support doesn’t adjust high enough either and it’s not nearly padded enough. Arm rests are SO HARD. Overall, not sure why the design team finalized this as the design apart from the actual look of it. Feel is way off. The seat looks so much more cushy on the site and in other review photos. I would return it if I could but it’s just too difficult to take apart at this point and to repackage the same way it came. Really wanted to love this one. 😭

The chair padding is of mediocre quality, I expected so much more from it for the price. I sat in a $50 desk chair at Home Goods the other week and it was 1,000 times more comfortable than the verve. The verve only lifts to 20.5” which is lower than the average desk chair. I’m 6 foot 185Lbs and thought it would be enough but falls way short. And it’s as if one is sitting on a very firm surface. The lumbar support doesn’t adjust high enough either and it’s not nearly padded enough. Arm rests are SO HARD. Overall, not sure why the design team finalized this as the design apart from the actual look of it. Feel is way off. The seat looks so much more cushy on the site and in other review photos. I would return it if I could but it’s just too difficult to take apart at this point and to repackage the same way it came. Really wanted to love this one. 😭

title: It’s alright…
body: The chair is fine. I did think it was going to be a bit larger. It’s definitely functional but by no means is it a stately chair. Bit narrow to be honest and for the price I’m surprised that the arms don’t have a bit more versatility. I was going to give it 2.5 stars but since that’s not a possibility I gave it 3. If I had to do it again, I would have liked to test the chair before purchasing.

Bit narrow to be honest and for the price I’m surprised that the arms don’t have a bit more versatility. I was going to give it 2.5 stars but since that’s not a possibility I gave it 3. If I had to do it again, I would have liked to test the chair before purchasing.

title: Not as comfortable as I hoped
body: Putting the chair together was very easy but after sitting in it for at least 6 hours every day, my bum was always almost falling asleep at the end of the day. It was not as comfortable as the reviews suggest, especially for $500+. I also did not think the lumbar support offered as much relief as I was hoping for. I think I can find a better chair elsewhere.
full_review: Not as comfortable as I hoped: Putting the chair together was very easy but after sitting in it for at least 6 hours every day, my bum was always almost falling asleep at the end of the day. It was not as comfortable as the reviews suggest, especially for $500+. I also did not think the lumbar support offered as much relief as I was hoping for. I think I can find a better chair elsewhere.

title: Good looking, not worth the price
body: I really wanted to love the Verve chair. I bought it because it is better looking than most office chairs. It does that well. Other than that, I think it's extremely overpriced. I'm having issues with the max height and arm adjustments. I was expecting this to be the most comfortable chair ever and it's just alright.
full_review: Good looking, not worth the price: I really wanted to love the Verve chair. I bought it because it is better looking than most office chairs. It does that well. Other than that, I think it's extremely overpriced. I'm having issues with the max height and arm adjustments. I was expecting this to be the most comfortable chair ever and it's just alright.

title: Love the chair but…
body: It is quite comfortable. However, the fabric on the seat is such a loose weave that within the first week, I had three pulls in it and NO idea how. Don’t have a cat, no zippers or rivets in my pants. I’d would like the chair replaced. Happy to send images.
full_review: Love the chair but…: It is quite comfortable. However, the fabric on the seat is such a loose weave that within the first week, I had three pulls in it and NO idea how. Don’t have a cat, no zippers or rivets in my pants. I’d would like the chair replaced. Happy to send images.

title: Tight Branding, Good Marketing, Average Product
body: It's okay - but it's not much of a step up from a basic Staples chair. Certainly not what I was hoping for. Controls feel cheap. Arm-rests wobble and the ratchet mechanism is finicky. The recline lock is sticky and difficult to get out of the rear-lockout position. The seat is too deep, even at it's 'shortest' setting for my 5'6" frame and I can't get space between the seat and my calves. Customer service is marginal so far - but I can't judge that yet. If you want to return it, it needs to be disassembled and re-packed in it's original packaging - good luck. Overall - I feel like Branch is over-promising and under-delivering on the calibre of this product.
full_review: Tight Branding, Good Marketing, Average Product: It's okay - but it's not much of a step up from a basic Staples chair. Certainly not what I was hoping for. Controls feel cheap. Arm-rests wobble and the ratchet mechanism is finicky. The recline lock is sticky and difficult to get out of the rear-lockout position. The seat is too deep, even at it's 'shortest' setting for my 5'6" frame and I can't get space between the seat and my calves. Customer service is marginal so far - but I can't judge that yet. If you want to return it, it needs to be disassembled and re-packed in it's original packaging - good luck. Overall - I feel like Branch is over-promising and under-delivering on the calibre of this product.

title: Forget personal touches
body: I put it together with ease but I cannot get the armrest to stay up or find something to explain how. Very frustrating.
full_review: Forget personal touches: I put it together with ease but I cannot get the armrest to stay up or find something to explain how. Very frustrating.

title: Would like to talk to someone
body:
Hi - this chair arrived quickly and was easy to assemble. It’s also a beautiful design that is nice enough to have in my living room for my office set up. 
One of the arm rests doesn’t adjust well and gets stuck. Given the price, I’d expect better. I’d like to follow up with someone to see if a new arm piece will be better. 
Also I’ve heard an occasional squeak when I lean the chair back which I wouldn’t expect. 
The chair is very comfortable and has many adjustments which are great except for the armrest issue. I’m much more comfortable compared with my last chair.

title: Great Look, Comfortable Back, Sore Butt
body: Love the look. Love the back feel and support. Can’t sit for long without sore butt.
full_review: Great Look, Comfortable Back, Sore Butt: Love the look. Love the back feel and support. Can’t sit for long without sore butt.

title: Feels Rickety
body: The seat and back of the chair are very nice, but the arms feel very wobbly and rickety. They're not easy to set at the same height, and 1 bump means that you can be sent all the way back to square one. For the price, I would expect something a bit more stable.
full_review: Feels Rickety: The seat and back of the chair are very nice, but the arms feel very wobbly and rickety. They're not easy to set at the same height, and 1 bump means that you can be sent all the way back to square one. For the price, I would expect something a bit more stable.

title: It’s on okay chair
body:
My experience has been good but not excellent. I find the seat to not be especially comfortable; at first it was firm but it’s now just kind of hard. I also find the arms extremely irritating, as with movement they will ratchet up out of position. It’s also not a good design that you lift the arms all the way up in order to lower them as I have to count the clicks in order to make sure the arms are the same height and haven’t gone so far up as to drop back down. 

The chair is fine, just doesn’t live up to my expectations from the reputation and reviews. At the price I would recommend it, even though I don’t love it as much as I’d hoped to.

The chair is fine, just doesn’t live up to my expectations from the reputation and reviews. At the price I would recommend it, even though I don’t love it as much as I’d hoped to.

title: 3 Stars
body: Chair is a lovely color and super comfy, but one of the arms immediately become stuck and I cannot manage to adjust it at all. Fortunately it got stuck at my preferred height but still frustrating as it can’t slide under my desk properly, so now I have to lower and raise my seat to fit it. Instead of just moving the arms down to tuck it under. Which is obviously a more difficult thing to have to readjust each time I sit at my chair.
full_review: 3 Stars: Chair is a lovely color and super comfy, but one of the arms immediately become stuck and I cannot manage to adjust it at all. Fortunately it got stuck at my preferred height but still frustrating as it can’t slide under my desk properly, so now I have to lower and raise my seat to fit it. Instead of just moving the arms down to tuck it under. Which is obviously a more difficult thing to have to readjust each time I sit at my chair.

title: 3 Stars
body: Not worth $600. This chair has a lot of potential but for it to be comfortable enough to me I need the armrests to be longer and the seat to be a few inches deeper. I have long legs and a wide rear and feel like I’m sliding off when I sit in this chair.
full_review: 3 Stars: Not worth $600. This chair has a lot of potential but for it to be comfortable enough to me I need the armrests to be longer and the seat to be a few inches deeper. I have long legs and a wide rear and feel like I’m sliding off when I sit in this chair.

title: Great chair, fragile seat fabric
body:
I really wanted to love this chair. The style is great, the comfort is excellent, and the materials are high quality...except for the fabric on the seat. You know, the place where the most friction and abrasion happens. In just a few days of use the material was already pulling and catching. If you have a cat or dog who might jump or sit on this chair, just know it is going to get ruined almost immediately. The seat is soft and really comfortable, but there's no way the cover fabric is going to hold up over time. It's telling that one of the things NOT covered under the warranty is the seat.

Too bad, this chair is really comfy and looks great, but the fragility of the seat material is solely responsible for my returning it.

title: You’ll Love It or Hate It!
body: Some things I liked about the chair is the seat cushion. It’s comfortable with a good balance of firm and softness to it. The cloth material used for the back rest has a nice feel to it. What I didn’t like are the arm rests, these are very narrow with no width adjustments. Armrests are also very wobbly. Didn’t like the backrest shape. It forces you into a very upright position. Which is ok, for short periods of time, however for me after 30 minutes in the chair being perfectly upright became very uncomfortable.

The cloth material used for the back rest has a nice feel to it. What I didn’t like are the arm rests, these are very narrow with no width adjustments. Armrests are also very wobbly. Didn’t like the backrest shape. It forces you into a very upright position. Which is ok, for short periods of time, however for me after 30 minutes in the chair being perfectly upright became very uncomfortable.

title: Misled by the online agent
body: Order the chair which is very good but the online agent misled me on the colour which is not what I was expecting.
full_review: Misled by the online agent: Order the chair which is very good but the online agent misled me on the colour which is not what I was expecting.

title: Beautiful chair, body is still adjusting
body: I like the look and the adjustments, but my body still seems to be getting used to the chair and I've been experiencing some more lower back pain. I'm hoping that resolves over time, but if not, may need to look at other options.
full_review: Beautiful chair, body is still adjusting: I like the look and the adjustments, but my body still seems to be getting used to the chair and I've been experiencing some more lower back pain. I'm hoping that resolves over time, but if not, may need to look at other options.

title: It's a pretty chair, but nothing amazing.
body: It's a pretty chair, but nothing amazing. They missed the estimated delivery time by a month. So I waited 4 months for it to arrive with no updates from the company. The seat is comfortable but not that different from my IKEA chair that was 1/4th of the price. I was hoping it would be lower to the ground based on the measurements, but it was actually less than an inch lower than my IKEA chair because of the seat cushion. I still like the look and feel of the chair but I wish I didn't spend as much on it. I can't really feel the lumbar support at all so I can't say it helps much.

So I waited 4 months for it to arrive with no updates from the company. The seat is comfortable but not that different from my IKEA chair that was 1/4th of the price. I was hoping it would be lower to the ground based on the measurements, but it was actually less than an inch lower than my IKEA chair because of the seat cushion. I still like the look and feel of the chair but I wish I didn't spend as much on it. I can't really feel the lumbar support at all so I can't say it helps much.

title: Comfortable but with shortcomings
body:
Overall, the chair is generally comfortable and performs better for me than what it replaced. However, the arms are very frustrating and poorly designed. The way the arm height adjusts is obnoxious. A simple lever/release on the backside of the arm that catches are various positions would have been incredibly better. Also, attaching the arms from behind rather than below would also be better as a way to allow more room to move one’s legs. As a result, I have removed the arms completely as they’re useless to me. 

Arms aside, the chair is quite comfortable. But there’s no way I would pay this amount again knowing what I know now.

title: Better than others I’ve tried
body: The chair is mostly comfortable. I’ve hard a hard time finding a chair with a small enough depth for me, this is the first one I’ve found that doesn’t cut into the back of my knee. However, the arm rests are not comfortable for me, they don’t adjust low enough for me due to my height and using them made my forearm start tingling so I ended up having to remove them all together. I wish there was an option to buy the chair without the armrests since they’re useless to me.

title: Comfy but adjustments are finnicky
body: The chair is comfy. I love the color options! The adjustment options are a bit finnicky to use but I'm not likely to touch them again once I've set them. I wasn't able to use one of the options (I think it was stuck and never bothered to try again).

title: verve chair
body: not as good as I thought it would be
full_review: verve chair: not as good as I thought it would be

title: Not for short/small people
body:
First off, I love the color of this chair, and it is overall very comfortable. I have two major issues, though. For smaller framed people, the armrests are absolutely useless. At their maximum height, the armrests are still about an inch lower than where my arms fall, and they're out way wider than is useful, with no way to adjust/angle in. Also infuriating is the mechanism for adjusting the armrests- if you need them at the top height, you'll spend your whole time adjusting them up one click at a time, counting the clicks, only to have the armrests fall down because, oops, you lifted one click too high. Also for shorter folks, the lumbar support doesn't adjust low enough for where I need it. Another nice thing would to have more customization for locking the chair in different positions. There are only 2 or 3 options for lean if you want to lock the chair in a position.

Overall I love the color and mesh back and it is a comfortable chair, but wish I would have splurged for a Hermann Miller or something in multiple sizes with more customization options especially due to the issues with armrests. If Branch comes out with a fix for the armrests, I'll happily purchase.

Also for shorter folks, the lumbar support doesn't adjust low enough for where I need it. Another nice thing would to have more customization for locking the chair in different positions. There are only 2 or 3 options for lean if you want to lock the chair in a position.

Overall I love the color and mesh back and it is a comfortable chair, but wish I would have splurged for a Hermann Miller or something in multiple sizes with more customization options especially due to the issues with armrests. If Branch comes out with a fix for the armrests, I'll happily purchase.

title: Comfortable chair but fabric is not durable and the pink color has defects
body:
I ordered two Verve chairs for my husband and I (black and pink) for Christmas this year. We both work from home and need a good chair for everyday use. They arrived no problem and we're very easy to assemble. I love the adjustability, the cushion in comfortable, and price-point was the best compared to other brands. 
My biggest gripe is the fabric on the seat. Within the first week of using the chair, two large yarns were pulled out of the knit. I dont wear a belt or anything so it's super disappointing that the fabric is already pulling apart and has only gotten worse in the three months since we unpacked them. The pink chair also doesn't hide defects in the plastic like the black one can. There are a few spots on the chair where the mold lines are very visible so it looks like there are obvious white lines running down the arms and where the mold ends were cut and sanded on the bottom of the chair. 

At the end of the day the fabric and aesthetic issues dont effect the use of the chair and it is a good office chair. If I ordered another one, I would order the black color instead and plan to put a cover or something on the seat from the start.

title: It’s a fine chair
body: Wasn’t blown away. It doesn’t feel that different from my regular chair and at times it feels cheap for the price
full_review: It’s a fine chair: Wasn’t blown away. It doesn’t feel that different from my regular chair and at times it feels cheap for the price

title: Great chair, with odd sounds
body: A very comfortable, supportive chair that arrived quickly and was easy to assemble. But as I move in it, something in the metal structure gives an annoying chiming sound., as though an old clock were chiming. I can’t find the cause.
full_review: Great chair, with odd sounds: A very comfortable, supportive chair that arrived quickly and was easy to assemble. But as I move in it, something in the metal structure gives an annoying chiming sound., as though an old clock were chiming. I can’t find the cause.

title: A great chair for most people I'm sure, just not for me
body:
Chair was assembled easily, solid construction and materials, and mostly comfortable.

My issues are a matter of size. I'm a tall, broad shouldered guy approaching the weight limit on the chair, around 6'1" 270Ibs. I knew buying this chair was a risk, but figured I'd give it a shot. 3 weeks in, I've just started the return process.

Another issue is that it doesn't accomodate all sitting positions well. If you sit with good posture 100% of the time, it works great. I like switching up seating positions frequently though, from good posture to slouching, to sitting cross legged, or one leg under the other. The seat is not big enough for all of those positions to be comfortable.

The arms only adjust up and down, it's missing the other 3 axes of adjustability (forward/backwards, swivel, narrower/wider). I didn't expect to miss 4-axis arms as much as I do. Minor gripe, but they could also adjust a little higher as well. At their highest position, they're just below perfect arm level for me.

A great chair for most people I'm sure, just not for me: Chair was assembled easily, solid construction and materials, and mostly comfortable.

Another issue is that it doesn't accomodate all sitting positions well. If you sit with good posture 100% of the time, it works great. I like switching up seating positions frequently though, from good posture to slouching, to sitting cross legged, or one leg under the other. The seat is not big enough for all of those positions to be comfortable.

The arms only adjust up and down, it's missing the other 3 axes of adjustability (forward/backwards, swivel, narrower/wider). I didn't expect to miss 4-axis arms as much as I do. Minor gripe, but they could also adjust a little higher as well. At their highest position, they're just below perfect arm level for me.

title: If you are above 6 feet tall don't buy this chair
body:
This chair does not accommodate my 6'3 215 pound ass very well. I'd say in general it needs about 1" extra on each side of the seat. Otherwise, my butt cheeks are putting side strain on the arm rests and have to be tightened regularly 

Additionally, I can tell this will likely go bust ass within year 2. I've had to regularly re-tighten all the other screws and this is likely the result of me being someone who works while leaning back in their chair. I can practically hear this chain psychically squealing in pain despite it apparently having a 275 pound limit. I base this off the fact that I previously had some generic Staples brad office chain and that lasted me nearly 7 years until the spring in the bottom literally gave way and fell out the bottom (snapped due to the fatigue). If this makes it past year 2, I'll be submitting this fact to the Catholic church to verify it as a miracle.

Also, why is it that not a single chair maker can figure out a lumbar support that doesn't suck ass? Whether it's my chain in my office or this one, these damn things never ever stay in place after you set their position. Would it be possible to have a 'lock in' mechanism or is that intentional? Either way having to constantly adjust that mfer is annoying and specifically with this chair it feels cheap. When I set it, it feels like it will just flop down to the bottom position immediately. With some wear on it, I have a feeling that this will be the case. 

So if you're a tiny person this chair probably is excellent on your bang for buck. For us less height-challenged people you probably should look elsewhere.

Additionally, I can tell this will likely go bust ass within year 2. Also, why is it that not a single chair maker can figure out a lumbar support that doesn't suck ass? Whether it's my chain in my office or this one, these damn things never ever stay in place after you set their position. Would it be possible to have a 'lock in' mechanism or is that intentional? Either way having to constantly adjust that mfer is annoying and specifically with this chair it feels cheap. When I set it, it feels like it will just flop down to the bottom position immediately. With some wear on it, I have a feeling that this will be the case. 

So if you're a tiny person this chair probably is excellent on your bang for buck. For us less height-challenged people you probably should look elsewhere.

title: Really sturdy and beautiful but not for tall people
body:
The Good: 
Very sturdy chair and a great build quality. Looks beautiful in the office. Lots of available adjustments 
The Bad: 
The arm rest adjustment is not button or lever based, you have to pull the arms to get the height you want. The problem is I always overshoot and pull the arm up too high. To go back down, you have to pull the arms up all the way and reset the hight adjustment. The adjustable back rest is great, but its not sturdy enough, it kinda slides down on its own sometimes. 
The Ugly: 
I have a $60 chair at home and its seat is big enough for it to reach under my knees. Now I am at an average height like 6ft tall and the chair is a good 2 inches short to my knees after adjusting the seat to the maximum position. If you’re 6ft tall and up, look elsewhere, cause it gets uncomfortable in a short time. 
Wishlist: 
Wish the chair came in more colors other than black, white and red-pink. The white is a stain magnet and the black looks really unimpressive, the red-pink is great but its too radical of a color to choose for my setup. The chair would look great in grey or a dark green. 
Wish the chair had arm rests that could be adjusted forward or sideways.
Verdict:
I appreciate what Branch is trying to do by making a cheaper chair with great build quality compared to all the Herman Millers out there. The chair does help you sit upright, but its just too damn short, at the least it needs an inch more of seat depth.

title: Fun color, but maybe not worth the high price
body: I bought this chair in the coral color a couple of months ago, and I love the color! It brightens up my office and looks fun in Zoom calls. Shipping and setup were both quick. However, for the price, I would have expected a better product. I constantly have to pull up the lumbar support, and the tilt/tilt lock is not well balanced. Either you tilt all the way back, or barely tilt, it would be nice to have a middle option. I was nervous about the armrests (due to other reviews), but I don't find them bothersome. Although it is fairly comfortable, I would expect a little higher quality for the high price. I would only recommend this product if you have the money to spend, rather than a splurge purchase.

title: Comfy but questionable quality
body: Super well designed ergonomic office chair. Just a little disappointed in the quality of the fabric - it's started to pill and when I contacted customer service, they said it was normal and to use a fabric shaver to fix the problem. Which is fine - just not something I expected for the price we paid.

Just a little disappointed in the quality of the fabric - it's started to pill and when I contacted customer service, they said it was normal and to use a fabric shaver to fix the problem. Which is fine - just not something I expected for the price we paid.

title: A Mixed Bag
body: This chair looked good in my space, and initially felt comfortable too. But after a couple days, my back was in agony. The lumbar support is too hard and protrudes too much into your back. I wish it had been removable. The arms are also pretty bad - too small, flimsy, and uncomfortable. Had to return it because of the pain.

The lumbar support is too hard and protrudes too much into your back. I wish it had been removable. The arms are also pretty bad - too small, flimsy, and uncomfortable. Had to return it because of the pain.

title: It's ok
body: Received fairly quickly, and customer service was quick to respond with my questions. The color is absolutely beautiful and materials seem to be ok but I don't feel it's worth the price. I've had gaming chairs for half this price that were alot more comfortable and ergonomic. This time I decided to go for aesthetic, and that's where I messed up. The armrests are hard plastic and flimsy. I was also expecting the body to be alot longer, just how it looks like in pictures. It's not, and I'm 5'2". So this chair is really suited for smaller people. I do like the reclining motion but it's hard getting it to lock in place when you want it to. Would be soooo much better if it had a head rest. Really hoping they come out with an attachment in the future. I don't hate it, but for almost 700 dollars that I spent, I was expecting to love it.

It's not, and I'm 5'2". So this chair is really suited for smaller people. I do like the reclining motion but it's hard getting it to lock in place when you want it to. Would be soooo much better if it had a head rest. Really hoping they come out with an attachment in the future. I don't hate it, but for almost 700 dollars that I spent, I was expecting to love it.

title: Not for petite people. Probably great for 90% of people…
body:
Had high hopes based on measurements. Btw, there’s a discrepancy between the measurements in the pdf vs what’s under the tabs.

I couldn’t find any reviews from petite people on here or externally. So in case you’re a shorty wondering if this is for you, I will say it’s not for me. While the measurements say it’s supposed to fit 5’3, I’m still uncomfortable, and often find myself sitting poorly to make up for how much I don’t actually fit.

The arms are far too wide for my frame, but I can set the right hight. Like everyone says, setting it sucks. Wish there was a button, because to set it you have to go all the way down then slowly go up using incremental clicks that lock the height in place. But it’s finicky and you could misaligned heights. 

The seat foam is thick and quite soft and comfy. I love the waterfall edge. But the pan is still too deep. I wish the height can also go just a tad lower for me. Since I wfm I don’t wear shoes. But now I have to wear something with a bit of a sole that helps. 

Love the soft rollers. They’re so smooth and quiet and don’t scuff up my hardwood floors. 

The chair is stylish and is probably great for 90% of users but for me, well the world isn’t made for me unfortunately and I will need to dish out extra dough.
full_review:
Not for petite people. Probably great for 90% of people…: Had high hopes based on measurements. Btw, there’s a discrepancy between the measurements in the pdf vs what’s under the tabs.

I couldn’t find any reviews from petite people on here or externally. So in case you’re a shorty wondering if this is for you, I will say it’s not for me. While the measurements say it’s supposed to fit 5’3, I’m still uncomfortable, and often find myself sitting poorly to make up for how much I don’t actually fit.

The arms are far too wide for my frame, but I can set the right hight. Like everyone says, setting it sucks. Wish there was a button, because to set it you have to go all the way down then slowly go up using incremental clicks that lock the height in place. But it’s finicky and you could misaligned heights. 

The seat foam is thick and quite soft and comfy. I love the waterfall edge. But the pan is still too deep. I wish the height can also go just a tad lower for me. Since I wfm I don’t wear shoes. But now I have to wear something with a bit of a sole that helps. 

Love the soft rollers. They’re so smooth and quiet and don’t scuff up my hardwood floors. 

The chair is stylish and is probably great for 90% of users but for me, well the world isn’t made for me unfortunately and I will need to dish out extra dough.

title: Armrests suck and not for a petite person
body: I had high hopes for this chair but it was disappointing in the end. It looked really nice and the seat and back were comfortable. But the armrests are horribly designed, you pull them all the way up to adjust them. If you accidentally pull the armrests while moving the chair, they fall to the lowest setting again. It was also not great as a very petite person because I needed the armrests to be able to move inward, for my elbows to be near my body (more ergonomic). Ultimately returned the chair. It might work for someone that can look past the arm rests.
full_review: Armrests suck and not for a petite person: I had high hopes for this chair but it was disappointing in the end. It looked really nice and the seat and back were comfortable. But the armrests are horribly designed, you pull them all the way up to adjust them. If you accidentally pull the armrests while moving the chair, they fall to the lowest setting again. It was also not great as a very petite person because I needed the armrests to be able to move inward, for my elbows to be near my body (more ergonomic). Ultimately returned the chair. It might work for someone that can look past the arm rests.

title: I love my purchase, but has room for improvement
body:
Overall I am satisfied with my purchase. I ordered the Mist White colour, and it’s the best looking chair on the market, no doubt. With that said, there are some qualms:
- The seat height is very lacklustre. If you are very tall, or just prefer a tall seat, this may not be for you. I am 5’ 8” and keep the chair on max height, which puts my legs bent at just above a 90° angle.
- As many other reviews have pointed out, the armrests are low quality compared to the rest of the chair. They wobble around as a result of the manufacturing tolerances being very loose. They have a nice feature of having no knobs or anything to adjust height, it makes for a very clean appearance. There still is no lateral adjustment, unfortunately.
- Lastly, while the seat base adjusts forward and back, it always feels like it’s every so slightly leaned forward, pushing me off the front of the chair. I wish I could adjust the seat forward/backward leaning angle.
- Seat back tension is not continuously adjustable. They have it adjustable in stepped increments. Not sure why they went with this approach, as it makes the reclining tension not work for the majority of people. I am slightly too heavy for the light option and slightly too light for the heavier option, so I am either propped fully upright or have to lean all the way back. Doesn’t work for me, so I always keep the chair locked in place at full upright position. If you like reclining, this may not be the chair for you.

With all that said, I do enjoy my purchase. I realise that I bought the product on preorder and am one of the first people in the world with the Branch Verve. So with that, I highly urge Branch to continue to improve and iterate on this product based on customer feedback, and hopefully I will be able to recommend it to others in the future. This chair has a lot of potential, and is a beautiful chair.

title: Just Okay
body: The chair’s seat is comfortable and does not irritate my back issues, but height wise it’s smaller than expected (does not work for my husband over 6 feet and almost too small for me at 5’10”). The armrests are uneven heights and the adjustments are clunky. The desk we purchased, however, is awesome.
full_review: Just Okay: The chair’s seat is comfortable and does not irritate my back issues, but height wise it’s smaller than expected (does not work for my husband over 6 feet and almost too small for me at 5’10”). The armrests are uneven heights and the adjustments are clunky. The desk we purchased, however, is awesome.

title: Not worth the price
body: The chair looks great and feels great. Overall it is a comfortable chair but definitely not $500 comfortable. I've used chairs in the $200-300 range that are just as comfortable. I don't think the design justifies the extra couple hundred dollars. My biggest problem with the chair is the arm rests. The way the arm resets lower and raise is just a bad design in my opinion. There is no button instead you just lift the arm rests and they're suppose to lock but they don't always do that. Overall I do like the chair but not the price and for that I can't recommend this model.
full_review: Not worth the price: The chair looks great and feels great. Overall it is a comfortable chair but definitely not $500 comfortable. I've used chairs in the $200-300 range that are just as comfortable. I don't think the design justifies the extra couple hundred dollars. My biggest problem with the chair is the arm rests. The way the arm resets lower and raise is just a bad design in my opinion. There is no button instead you just lift the arm rests and they're suppose to lock but they don't always do that. Overall I do like the chair but not the price and for that I can't recommend this model.

title: Full of potential with small issues that drag this chair's reputation down the hill -_-
body:
The negatives:

QUALITY CONTROL, CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND ETC:
First of all, if you do your research of buyers of this chair and other product from Branch most people have problem with quality control and other issues like shipping and customer service. And for that I take one star off this chair. When this Chair arrive, it was packed perfectly and seem to be careful. Only when I opened it, there are are some dirty marks on the hard parts. Thankfully it is not the fabric section. I was able to wiped off with alcohol wipes cloth. But to me, this kind of issue is clearly either they resell returned item or the warehouse people just not know how to pack item with cleanliness. It is disgusting. ALSO, on the seat there is a threat hanging out. This indicated that the fabric was not weave carefully. Although it is just a single threat but imaging it will worn out over time and tear off. For chair with fabric, it is crucial that the weaving is tight and clean. It is not suppose to have thread hanging out like this.

PERFORMANCE:
--- I would say that I have to wait for a few days to see for my self but as for now what I can tell is that this chair is not for anyone who big and tall. The seat cannot go higher than I would want it to be.The height adjustable is limited but not to the point that it is a disappointment. I just rather to have more height option.
--- The Armrest is not even mildly soft. its below mildly soft. I would say you can barely feel the cushion and softness. Its like they designed this piece to be a decor rather than something that actually support your elbow. According to the site and customer service, they will likely to release armrest with more comfortable cushion in the future along with the headrest as addtional part. PERSONALLY, in my opinion, other high end chair like TITAN EVO 2022 from SECRET LAB have these option already included with the chair. However, that chair is gaming chair. But for the same price, they included armrest with cushion, magnetic headrest pillow, lumbar support and etc. The verve chair however, cannot compete with SECRET LAB additional add on for the same price.
--- Lumbar support is below the mid point of your spine, I would prefer to have it a litter higher to the mid spine but what ever. it is functional i guess for most people
--- The fabric of the back rest is very rough. Now, it is the same fabric on the seat which is fine because the seat weave pattern is weave different for smooth and comfort. The back rest is weave in. a pattern that some what irritating if you rest you back with out wearing a shirt or so. It will literally irritate your skin if you dont wear shirt and have your skin rub against the back rest

the positive:
--- The seat is comfortable for now but I have to use for several more day to see for myself. The seat foam is so bouncy but not too soft or too hard. You probably need to seat so often to see if it will shrink down to a flat point.
--- I like that the frame is heavy and solid
--- Instruction is very easy to the point you can just assume how it is attached together. Very Straightforward.


With that being said, I am not disappointing but rather annoyed that this chair and this price still have super basic issues that can be solve easily and still stay at the price offer. This is why I took 2 stars away from this.

title: 2 Stars
body: BEWARE. POOR QC. Bought 3 items from branch and all three were lemons. Chair came with arm rests that doesn’t stay up and paid another $100 for a headrest that wobbles. Emailed and did not get any helpful response. 5h after assembling disassembling and proving the issue with rep, following up unanswered emails, and trying to resolve the issue, branch finally admit fault and would send me the spare parts but with compensation of my wasted time. I am not hopeful in claiming my warranty in the future. Probably better off going with the big brands
full_review: 2 Stars: BEWARE. POOR QC. Bought 3 items from branch and all three were lemons. Chair came with arm rests that doesn’t stay up and paid another $100 for a headrest that wobbles. Emailed and did not get any helpful response. 5h after assembling disassembling and proving the issue with rep, following up unanswered emails, and trying to resolve the issue, branch finally admit fault and would send me the spare parts but with compensation of my wasted time. I am not hopeful in claiming my warranty in the future. Probably better off going with the big brands

title: Lovely chair, now useless
body: Chair is great, wife loved it. Unfortunately our dog chewed up one of the arm pads and Branch does not make replacement parts available, so now the whole chair is kinda useless. Pretty unacceptable for a $600 chair, and more than a little disappointing. When they say they make their chairs affordable, what they mean is they run the business too lean to offer customer service.

Unfortunately our dog chewed up one of the arm pads and Branch does not make replacement parts available, so now the whole chair is kinda useless. Pretty unacceptable for a $600 chair, and more than a little disappointing. When they say they make their chairs affordable, what they mean is they run the business too lean to offer customer service.

title: Overpriced and uncomfortable
body: Great looking chair but did not work out for me. The armrests are too high, even at the lowest position, and rock hard. It gave me significant shoulder/neck pain after only 4 hours of use. Should not have been recommended for my height. The seat is soft and sufficiently padded. Lumbar support is nonexistent. I had trouble with the returns portal but customer service was quick to respond.
full_review: Overpriced and uncomfortable: Great looking chair but did not work out for me. The armrests are too high, even at the lowest position, and rock hard. It gave me significant shoulder/neck pain after only 4 hours of use. Should not have been recommended for my height. The seat is soft and sufficiently padded. Lumbar support is nonexistent. I had trouble with the returns portal but customer service was quick to respond.

title: I am extremely disappointed in this chair!
body:
1- the seat pitches you forward. Hard to sit normally with your back against the chair.
2- if you maximize the seat depth a gap is created between the seat cushion and the frame. You can feel it when you sit. Very uncomfortable.
3- the armrests are too far apart and you can not adjust them.
4- in order to return the chair I would have to disassemble it and try to maneuver the various parts back into the boxes they came in. Assembly wasn't bad, but I'm a senior citizen, just the thought of disassembly is daunting. 
5- the seat cushion is comfortable enough but nothing special. Certainly didn't help ease the pain in the butt I feel after a few hours sitting.

FYI I am an average sized 5'8" woman, 158 pounds.

I feel like I threw away $600. The you tube reviewers were correct. Surprised the reviews here are so positive.

4- in order to return the chair I would have to disassemble it and try to maneuver the various parts back into the boxes they came in. Assembly wasn't bad, but I'm a senior citizen, just the thought of disassembly is daunting.

body:
I'm 6'2" and 185 pounds, and overall I like the style and comfort of the chair. 

That said, it was 3 times the cost of my previous chair and started squeaking less than one month from when I purchased it. Would expect better for something this expensive.

title: Disappointing
body: The chair is on par with the standard $150 to $200 option from your local office supply store. Not bad just expensive for what you get. I do like the color though. Please know, your chair with come with holes drilled into the top because they are trying to upsell you an extra accessory so if you don't want it, you are punished with empty holes in your $550 chair. Such an aggressively greedy move from Branch. Poor form.

title: Not for me
body: This chair is simply not for me. I am 5 feet tall, and found the armrests to be way too low, even on the highest setting. It is a huge pain to adjust the armrests. If you pull it up too high, it goes all the way back down. The armrests are also very small and set far apart, making them useless for me. The seat is also harder than expected. I had to send it back.

If you pull it up too high, it goes all the way back down. The armrests are also very small and set far apart, making them useless for me. The seat is also harder than expected. I had to send it back.

title: Not comfortable for average size adult
body: I am a 5'7" person, but I find the chair seat does not lower enough for my feet to touch the ground, and the arms of the chair do not raise enough for me to sit and type comfortably. The arms seem cheap and unstable as well. I loved the look of this chair, and the mint color is pretty, but I was hoping it would be more functional.

The arms seem cheap and unstable as well. I loved the look of this chair, and the mint color is pretty, but I was hoping it would be more functional.

title: Verve Chair
body: Not a great chair for the price. It's not very comfy, the lumbar support doesn't lock into place so it always moves back down and the armrests are hard
full_review: Verve Chair: Not a great chair for the price. It's not very comfy, the lumbar support doesn't lock into place so it always moves back down and the armrests are hard

title: Too short for tall people
body: The chair is great but it's too short for me. I'm 6"1. It said in the description it's good for someone up to 6"2 but even at its maximum height, it's missing a few inches for me to be comfortable. In the end I still use my Järvfjället Ikea chair that's half the price and just as comfortable.
full_review: Too short for tall people: The chair is great but it's too short for me. I'm 6"1. It said in the description it's good for someone up to 6"2 but even at its maximum height, it's missing a few inches for me to be comfortable. In the end I still use my Järvfjället Ikea chair that's half the price and just as comfortable.

title: Pretty but uncomfortable
body: This chair has lot’s of potential but it kills my back!! The lumbar support is too hard and the chair sits too straight up and down. Takes a lot of effort to recline even on the setting with the least tension.
full_review: Pretty but uncomfortable: This chair has lot’s of potential but it kills my back!! The lumbar support is too hard and the chair sits too straight up and down. Takes a lot of effort to recline even on the setting with the least tension.

title: Chair review
body: Very poor design with the arm not very adjustable and is blocking hands from reaching the adjustment levers underneath the seat. The seat cushion is not comfortable with something hard below the cushion only in the area in the middle part of the seat. The tilt lock is very difficult to get the lock engaged. In fact, I emailed Branch support about the tilt lock last week and have yet to receive any response from Branch (poor customer service). Thinking of return the chair, but too much work to disassemble and too heavy to haul.

body:
Seat padding is too soft. It compresses all the way to the base making it feel like I'm sitting on a wooden bench. This is not a comfortable chair at all. For the record, I weigh 170 lbs. 

Wish I could return for a full refund.

body: I wanted to love this chair, as it is expertly designed. However, it was so painfully uncomfortable that I could not use it for more than 30 seconds without experiencing the start of back and leg pain.the seat cushion is perfectly flat and rather hard, and the back support is sparse.

title: The arms keep falling.
body: I bought this chair in December of 22. The arms keep falling, I regret my purchase.
full_review: The arms keep falling.: I bought this chair in December of 22. The arms keep falling, I regret my purchase.

title: Broke in 3 months
body: I paid full price for this chair in December and ended up unboxing it beginning of January. I use it daily for office work I work from home and it has gotten jean stains, and major rips throughout the seat of the chair. I will have to replace it already and it's been about 2 months of daily use. Definitely do not recommend if you plan to use on a daily basis. It does not have the strength to hold up. My prior office chair was a gaming chair from Razor and was perfect for 3 years, I just thought it was time to replace the pink to a more sleek design. However, I do not recommend this chair if you are a work from home user. And overall, it wasnt very comfortable.

title: Worst chair I've ever used
body: Terrible experience. I can't sit on it for more than 30 minutes without excruciating lower back pain and I'm only 23. Sitting on the floor is genuinely more comfortable for me. I've tried adjusting it a bunch and nothing helps me.
full_review: Worst chair I've ever used: Terrible experience. I can't sit on it for more than 30 minutes without excruciating lower back pain and I'm only 23. Sitting on the floor is genuinely more comfortable for me. I've tried adjusting it a bunch and nothing helps me.

title: Smallest arms ever
body: Most things about this chair are great but I cannot recommend because for over $500 the arm quality is atrocious. The length of the arm rest are so short and they do not support my arms. The arm rests are also ROCK hard. I have to buy arm pads just to get rid of the red marks they have left on my arms. It hurts so bad. And the adjustability of the arms (up & down) is not at all user friendly. It took my husband and I forever to just figure out how to get them to stay up. And even after we figured it out we still have trouble with it. It’s too much trouble to send back so now i am just stuck with a $500+ chair that I really don’t love.
full_review: Smallest arms ever: Most things about this chair are great but I cannot recommend because for over $500 the arm quality is atrocious. The length of the arm rest are so short and they do not support my arms. The arm rests are also ROCK hard. I have to buy arm pads just to get rid of the red marks they have left on my arms. It hurts so bad. And the adjustability of the arms (up & down) is not at all user friendly. It took my husband and I forever to just figure out how to get them to stay up. And even after we figured it out we still have trouble with it. It’s too much trouble to send back so now i am just stuck with a $500+ chair that I really don’t love.

title: Incredibly expensive, bad customer support
body:
I had two major complaints one with Branch in general and one with the chair:

The chair: I’m 6’2” 220 lbs and it’s just not comfortable. It’s as comfortable as a generic office max 100$ chair. Definitely not worth the price. The arm rests are so dumb. They’re elbow rests at best 
My wife is 5’ 2” 100 lbs and she described it as the same so it isn’t just because of my size. Just overall an average quality chair. I would not pay more than 150$ for it. 

Branch in general:
I bought this chair directly from branch rather than Amazon because I wanted them to get a higher percentage of the profits. Two days later this was on a flash sale for $100 less than I bought it for. I reached out to support and asked to get the difference back or just a credit so I could buy a storage unit or something but they denied all of that and just pointed to their policy of 35$ returns. I returned the chair and bought a refurbished steel case from a retailer for less than this chair and haven’t looked back. 

You should cut out the middle man , save $35 of return fee man and just get something else.

My wife is 5’ 2” 100 lbs and she described it as the same so it isn’t just because of my size. Just overall an average quality chair. I would not pay more than 150$ for it. 

Branch in general:
I bought this chair directly from branch rather than Amazon because I wanted them to get a higher percentage of the profits. Two days later this was on a flash sale for $100 less than I bought it for. I reached out to support and asked to get the difference back or just a credit so I could buy a storage unit or something but they denied all of that and just pointed to their policy of 35$ returns. I returned the chair and bought a refurbished steel case from a retailer for less than this chair and haven’t looked back. 

You should cut out the middle man , save $35 of return fee man and just get something else.

title: Still Waiting
body: I ordered the chair on 8/25, and was advised it was in stock. It is now 9/15 and still no chair. I got the desk, which is very nice…but alas, there is no chair to sit at it with.
full_review: Still Waiting: I ordered the chair on 8/25, and was advised it was in stock. It is now 9/15 and still no chair. I got the desk, which is very nice…but alas, there is no chair to sit at it with.

title: Comfy Trash 🗑️
body:
Certainly, here's a revised version of the review that includes your additional points:

"Take this as a public service announcement: steer clear of this abysmal $600 office chair. Sure, it seemed comfy at first, but don't let that fool you. In under 6 months, a hole has already formed, which means it's only a matter of time before the cushion starts to disintegrate.

What's worse? Their customer service is a sham. When I reached out for a solution, they simply shrugged it off, saying this kind of issue isn't covered. Unbelievable.

Save your hard-earned money and invest it somewhere else, preferably in a company that actually stands behind their products. As for me, I'm so incensed that I'll be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau. $600 for a chair that starts falling apart in half a year? Absolutely not."

title: Poor Quality For The Money Spent
body: The chairs padding has just about nothing left after only a couple of months and has become extremely uncomfortable. For $600 I cant believe how cheap this chair feels. We also had the same experience with the desk we purchased from Branch. Wouldn't recommended the products for the amount of money spent.
full_review: Poor Quality For The Money Spent: The chairs padding has just about nothing left after only a couple of months and has become extremely uncomfortable. For $600 I cant believe how cheap this chair feels. We also had the same experience with the desk we purchased from Branch. Wouldn't recommended the products for the amount of money spent.

title: Highly Overrated!
body:
Not happy with this product. There is no tilt option for the seat, this combined with the slight tilt forward of the seat, and the poor back and lumbar design, make for an ergonomic mess. The assembly and tear down, with repacking, is 2.5 hrs. at best.
And beware! You will need a large pipe wrench and rubber mallet to disassemble, it's a real junk show this one. Finally: Branch spends its money on advertising and 5 Star reviews, Not on their product. If I was completely happy with the comfort and support of this chair I would value it at $200-$250, THIS IS NOT A $500 CHAIR!

title: Run in the seat fabric
body: After only one month of gentle use, there's already a very large pull in the fabric of the seat. Not made to last.
full_review: Run in the seat fabric: After only one month of gentle use, there's already a very large pull in the fabric of the seat. Not made to last.

title: The Chair delivered Without any Screws
body:
I ordered this chair very excited for it to arrive and it arrived with no instruction manual, no washers, brackets, screw, or Allen key to set it up. Can you imagine, you have the prices but can’t connect them? On top of that there is no phone number to contact the company. There is only an email and leaving a voice note feature to get it addressed. After paying so much for a chair, you’d atleast expect prompt customer service. It’s been about 32 hours and I have not heard back from them despite contacting them immediately. 

I’m very disappointed and I’m looking forward to how they plan to address this and reciting my confidence in this brand. I currently do not plan on recommending it to anyone.
